text: From the tap at Tofflers Pub and Grill in New Glarus. Pours hazy golden colored with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma if sweet banana, apples, and cinnamon.. Flavor is malts, banana, pears and apples. Decent, but I just smell a little too much banana and cinnamon for my liking

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 Pours a hazy yellow on tap with bubbly white head that leaves good lace. Aroma of mild banana and clove esters over a nice sweet malty wheat underneath. Taste is bigger on all aspects, but smooth and clean with a very light body. Wow, open fermented goodness.

Effervescent fruity beer with a great aroma. Perfect summer beer! Would buy again! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle. Hazy orange. Big white head. Smells of clove, banana, wheat, bubblegum, and a little fruity yeastiness. Tastes much more wheaty. Banana. Spicy clove in the back end. A little bubblegum in the finish with sweet banana fruitiness lingering. High carbonation. Medium body. I dont drink a lot of hefes, so I dont have a lot of comparison knowledge, but Im really impressed.

Nice aroma of cinnamon and clove hit your nose right when you open the bottle. Appearance is golden yellow in color with a nice fading white head. Taste of clove and some spices hit your taste buds. medium body, lively carbonation Also sits well on the palate. Overall another solid beer from New Glarus.
12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with some head and a little retention. Nose of yeast, cloves, banana esters, and fruit. Taste follows the nose with a little bubble gum tossed in.

Out of the bottle, poured a deep gold, hazy, with a huge rocky persistent head. I got notes of banana, clove, boozy banana bread, wrigleys juicy fruit gum, candy sugar, and wheat malt. Bottle purchased directly from brewery does not have an ABV written on it, but RB is listing it at 7.2% which feels right - it packs a punch for a wheat beer. Love it.

Bottle from Greg (gregwilsonstl) -- cheers! This is one intense wheat beer. Its got all of the classic elements of Hefeweizen -- the grain and hay taste from the wheat and the bubblegum/orange/clove esters from the yeast -- but its all amplified, especially the yeast notes. Really good, really bold.

Intense esters, sweet grain and bread malts, caramel, bubble gum, more molasses. Hazy gold, medium, creamy, white head. Heavy sweet. More sweet grain malts, bread and caramel, sweet esters, soft carbonation, heavy bodied. Very nice Weizenbock, maybe a touch too sweet for me. Bottle from brewery, New Glarus, WI.
Bottled. Small sample. Old note. The aroma has light cloves, banana, some grain. Hazy, yellow coloured beer with a medium sized white head. The taste is light bitter and refreshing. Good one.

12 ounce bottle from Badger Spirits in Beloit, WI, served in a New Glarus weizen glass at cellar temp or so. Huge pop when the cap comes off, and it pours an enormous gout of foam, which subsides fairly quickly atop the lightly oily-cloudy golden body...on the nose, its bubblegum-bubblegum-bubblegum; I dont often use that word, maybe because I was never a bubblegum guy and havent chewed it for decades, but this beer more than any other I can remember brought me back to the days of Bubble Yum, Bubblicious, and especially Bazooka and the Bazooka Joe comics. Man, the memories! Who knew that bubblegum aroma in a weizenbock is my madeleine? Anyway theres also some banana and I could swear some mint in this utterly entrancing nose, and I keep going at it for minutes, forgetting to drink, reveling in the past...finally I take a sip, and (no surprise), the rose-colored glasses are off, and Im back to the present, and not 8 years old again asking for another quarter to put in the candy machine for another pack of Bazooka Joe, just inside the entrance to the Beloit Kohls grocery store...sigh...its decent enough, with that bready malt fairly rich, sweet - perhaps too sweet - but with enough sourness coming through on the end to keep it from getting TOO cloying, or it would be if not for the rather low carbonation level...finishes sweet, bready, thick. I have the feeling this bottle was a little old - a mix-a-six bottle and I think this is one of the lesser-selling varieties, at least at this store. Hey, Im burping gum! If a bubble should come out, thisll get a 5.0. Wait for it...sigh...no. You cant go home again.
12 oz. bottle purchased at the brewery. Poured hazy golden, huge foamy white head. Aroma was banana, spices, bubblegum, clove. Taste was clove, banana and bubblegum. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours mostly clear pale gold with nice white head. Nose and taste is bananas, bubblegum, clove, strawberry cream. Slight tartness in the aftertaste.
Bottle at the Local DC Tasting. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, banana, yeast. Tastes of banana, yeast, herbs, light citrus. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
12oz bottle at the July DC tasting. Poured a hazy straw yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots of Wheat, hay. Banana and light cloves come out on this one too. Pretty solid wheat ale.

Light florals and some wheat. Potpourri sense. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet finish with some tang. Great balance and easy drinking. Bottle shared at tasting, big thanks to iphonephan.

Draft. Pours light amber with thick white head and lacing. Wheat and lemon citrus aroma with clove and pepper notes. Honey wheat malt upfront with banana, coriander and spice. Some cherry notes and anise in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Super spiced wheat beer. Lots of clove and lemon peel. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Good stuff.
12 oz bottle from the brewer. Cloudy almost murky dark yellow. White frothy head. Aroma is banana with a touch of lemon peel. Taste is banana and clove. pretty basic but executed to style.
Pretty much a delicious textbook heff. Banana, cloves, etcetc. Another perfect beer by these folks.

bottle. Poured cloudy yellow with a big white head. Aroma of candy bananas. Medium-light body, creamy-smooth carbonation leaves a soft mouthful. Flavour of wheat malt, sweet orange citrus with notes of coriander, clove, and faint pepper.
Bottle. Clear golden color, big fluffy white head with good retention and lacing. Nice aroma of banana, lemony bubblegum, light clove. Taste is lightly spiced and slightly sour fruit. Very tasty.
12oz bottle shared. Clear golden pour, slight head. Strong banana and bread aroma. Taste follows, nice and light. Different and delicious.
Bottle thanks to DeyHolla! Slightly hazy medium gold with a massive white head. Strong banana esters. Clove. Baked bread. Fairly sweet flavor. Banana and honey. Easy drinking, pillowy carb. Nice.
Smells like a banana hefeweizen. Taste is heavy banana, yeast, and mild lemon.

12oz bottle, thanks to beerpig317. Code on bottle reads 1344 07:12. Yikes. A huge chunk of congealed yeast just slipped into the glass as I poured this. Looks alright otherwise. Hazy orange color. Audibly fizzing finger of white bubbly head. Fades to a thin amount. Loose bits of lace. Soft, kind of tingly stronger carbonation. Bigger body. Light slick. Bigger banana. Kind of spicier. Bit of bready malt in the back. Moderate-plus sweet taste. Moderate bitter. Interesting, flavorful, but ultimately just alright weizenbock. Kind of stronger carbonation, not very complex malt, a bit dry. Wonder how old it is? Eh. Left the last abnormally yeasty bit in the glass. I ought to retry a fresher example.

Bottle: Thanks to Corey for my first ever bottle of this. Hazy, translucent, & dense golden-amber body with an enormous, pillowing & chunky white head. Slowly receding, lots of fat lacing left on the glass. The nose brings bouts of sweet doughy malts, heavy yeast esters of clove & bubblegum, light mint, a faint touch of Candi sugar, some over-ripe banana, orange zest, & mild pear skin. Heavy sweet bread & commanding yeast finish. Lovely flavor that is robust & full, yet doesnt weigh too heavy on the palate. Strong wheat, light grains, buttered & freshly baked bread, semisweet banana, pear, faint plum, clove, coriander, with just a kiss of musky leafiness & a modest earthy twinge from the hop additions. Finishes with a mouth coating of Bavarian yeast esters, bready wheat, & faint citrus zest. Medium bodied, just outside of chewy. One of the best American renditions of this German style, without a doubt. Fantastic.

12oz bottle accidentally aged 4 months and poured into a footed pilsner glass. The aromas are very distinct with notes of clove, banana, pear, and a touch of cinnamon. After awhile, it kind of becomes reminiscent of banana bread as some of the grains come through. Theres oranges in there too, as well as a light acetone touch (but that could be from the unintentional aging). It looks like a hefe; its a hazy, unfiltered yellow-gold color with big, creamy, frothy white head that excellently retains a thick, fuzzy ring with an island and leaves and abundant, messy, puffy lace. Its a balanced medium sweet and bitter with just a touch of citrus sour. Theres a light zip to the carbonation on this thin, smooth, light bodied beer. Its an easy drinker with notes of apple scone early, followed by spicy honey, some banana, and bread late. Spice and honey finish the beer and it leaves a sweet fruit and light bitter citrus aftertaste with some wheat notes. Its crisp, dry, and touch astringent.

Cloudy, golden, white head, and lite lacing. Wheat and citrus aroma. Lite bodied, citrus, mild wheat, lite creamy texture. Mild dryness, mild bitterness and decent balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Serving: Bottle. It pours a cloudy gold with a lasting white head. Nice light clove nose with a touch of earth. Bright, crisp flavor with notes of wheat, yeast, and clove. Had no idea this was 7.2%. Really nice beer.

"SHOCKING NEWS!!! New Glarus makes ANOTHER awesome wheat beer! I swaer, they got the fruit and wheat beers styles down pat! HUGE aroma of bubble gum, banana and clove explodes out of the bottle. looks like youd expect, with a nice frothy head. heavier feel due to the elevated abv, and a great flavor that just about matches the aroma. black wheat, crackd wheat, and now this are probably 3 of my favorite 7 or 8 wheat beers from anywhere. only a couple german places rival these wheats! nice job, NG, and thanks Lou for the trade."

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, some banana esters, pale and caramel malts, and some light dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A pretty standard beer.

Bottle as an extra in trade from forget who. Have had this sitting for a while so hopefully not past it's prime. Pours hazy golden colored with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma if sweet honey, pears, apples, wheat malts, coriander. Flavor is sweet Bavarian wheat malts, some crisp spiciness, pears and apples galore, honey balanced with crisp bitterness. Light plus bodied with lots of carbonation and very easy drinking. A nice hefe.
This is so good. Aromas of fresh banana, a hint of citrus, and beautiful warm spice notes. Flavors are banana, citrus, cinnamon. So refreshing and flavorful

Bottle from trade. Pours a cloudy light orange with a large white head. Aromas of sweet artificial banana flavoring and not much else. Taste is slightly spicy, and semi dry. Flavors of clove-y banana esters from the yeast along with some other spice, perhaps a touch of white pepper. Not exactly the cleanest beer in the world, but it petes pretty good. Medium-high boost which is completely masked. Standard German type weizen, although Im not sure wh th bock part comes in. Good.
On tap at New Glarus. Poured light hazy gold with white head. Aroma of classic hefe. Light carb med bod. Banana wheat taste.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong yeast, spice, pepper. Medium mouthfeel with sweet malt, clove, pepper, and nice sweet finish.
I like wheat beers but this is not what I had expected. I prefer the wheat ales like Washington Island Wheat from Capital Brewery.

pretty excited to taste this after Tobys review of this. First off this was very overcarbonated which bummed me out but the head receded soon enough. Poured a hazy golden color with a much too large head. Nose was pale malts and lemon zest. Tasted like a nice summertime beer. Wheat plays out nicely with the tartness of the lemon. There is also some light funk that i didnt expect but mixes in great. This was nice
Bottle. Simple and refreshing all-around great wheat beer. A smooth cherry-banana bread flavor accented with cloves and spice.

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 6-29-14. Yeasty aroma features scents of bubblegum, banana bread, and chlorine. Pretty good hefeweizen/weizenbock smell. Theres not a lot to the smell, but it is pleasant. The aroma is on the dry side for the style. Pours a hazy bronze or medium tan with a moderate amount of beige head. Produces short-lasting lacing. Flavors of lemon and white vinegar. Tastes sharper and tarter than is typical for the style. Banana bread aftertaste. Lively, dusty, frothy palate. Good palate for the style, but the body is too light to stand out among all beers. Overall, New Glarus Dancing Man Wheat is actually a below average American hefeweizen, if one considers it that, and an even further below average weizenbock and stands as a major disappointment. I love a good German-style wheat beer in the summer, and I had heard this is a great one, but it is not even close to that reputation. This stands as another disappointment from a brewery with a ton of goodwill among craft beer fans but that struggles to produce outstanding beers aside from their truly special fruit concoctions and a small proportion of their Thumbprint Series brews.

Pours a nice amber with a thick head. There is a fruity smell to it. The taste is nice and sweet with a banana-ish flavor and a slight bitter finish. If you like wheat beer, try this. If you dont like wheat beer, try this. Its a really good beer.

Cloudy, yellow-orange with a fair amount of white head. Smells overwhelmingly of orange, melons. Lightly grassy. Quite sweet, some bitterness lasting through the finish. Medium finish, not quite light body, very effervescent. Exceedingly well balanced. Very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured golden cloudy yellow with clean white frothy head. Strong banana smell. So strong it has an essence of bubble gum. Taste is also bubble gum with mice mouthfeel and a spicy finish which is probably attributed to the Bavarian yeast. A very good representation of the style.

Pours golden with a huge, foamy, white head. Nose is popping with banana esters, some spice and barnyard notes. Taste is well-balanced: subtly sweet with a delicate hop edge. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Very nice wheat beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Banana, clove, cinnamon, and wheat drive right from the aroma onto the palate. Unfiltered, so it is nice and chewy. Lots of big, bold flavor from this hefeweizen. Alcohol is well hidden, so it can be a little sneaky.

Pours a bright gold with a thick white head that dissipates in an appropriate time. Keeps a nice thin layer of white over the top. Smells of banana and clove. First taste is banana with a lingering clove finish.

12 oz bottle. (Kwik Trip) Lake Mills, WI.
Clear pale golden colour with a small white head. 
Yeast, wheat, caramel malt and mild bitterness in the aroma. 
Yeast, wheat, malt and bitterness in the flavour. Excellent.

Pours a cloudy gold with a beautiful creamy two finger head that doesnt let up much.

Smell is centered around clove although lemons and a hint of banana follow.

Lemon is the first thing I notice in the palate and is prevalent throughout. A little bit of bubblegum and pepper make their way in and it finishes heavily spicy from clove.

Mouthfeel is spot on. A bit creamy and the higher than normal ABV for a Hefe helps.

Very good beer, but pales in comparison to the Live Oak I had last week. I prefer less clove in my Hefes and this one is centered around clove. That said, its not way out of balance and the lemon flavors do a pretty good job of balancing out the spice. Will definitely seek this out again.

Pours a hazy golden color with a big foamy two finger head that hangs around and says wassup. Big fruity wheat notes mingle with sweet bubblegum and a trace of spice. The palate follows with a great quenching mouthfeel, some nice citrus balanced off some of the fresh wheat notes and lightly spiced yeast quality ! Really a great wheat beer.
Really? Do you just take all your "standard" beers and make them a mild ale of some sort? Come on. I love your fruits and unchained series, but this is shit.
Pours golden with a slight haze. Head is sticky and lasting. Good banana aroma mixed with some spice and just a touch of bubblegum. Flavor similar. Good. Thanks to Tastybeer

Bottle. Pours golden with healthy white head, no lacing. Bubblegum, banana, clove on the nose. Texture is thin -- light body, effervescent carbonation. Wheat, citrus come into play in the taste. Short, crisp finish. Overall: nice, though the texture is a bit thin for me.

A nice wheat beer with great color and a mild fruit aroma. The beer is a lighter wheat that makes for good drinking in warmer weather.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle. bottled on 3/29/13. Not super fresh, but decent for a hefeweizen. It pours a briliant gold color with a huge rocky white head that settles to a thin layer in about 2 minutes. The aroma is balanced and nuanced for the style with good wheat bread, mild banana and bubblegum sweetness. Nothing stands out as too strong. The flavor is light and refreshing. Just a hint of tartness and bubblegum. Lots of wheat and very spritzy mouthfeel, yet nice smooth body. Top notch Hefeweizen.

The beer pours a hazy golden color with an inviting foaming white head. The efferferscence is lively, with notes of clove. This indeginous beer is truly a remarkable artisanHefe Weizen and should be held in high esteem. 
I enjoy this beer with a creamy cheese that stick to the roof of the mouth and experience the bubbles dance the palate clean. Remarkable!
Decent wheat beer. Light, hazy, slight citrus taste. Decent mouthfeel with a bit of lemon zest. An overall wheat flavor, but could be a bit more upfront. Easy drinking.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Spice and some light wheat aromas. Flavor is light wheat and mild spices.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a slightly cloudy dark gold with a finger of white head. Aroma of wheat and clove with a hint of banana. Taste is medium sweet. Wheat and banana with clove and spices. Light bodied with a thin texture. Lively carbonation and a very long finish. Overall, awesome. Another great New Glarus brew.

Hazy yellow color with a fairly high amount of carbonation and filmy head. Aroma of cloves, banana, wheat, and pale malts. Flavor is bananas, pale/pils-malts, cloves, bubblegum, and wheat. Body is light and has a crisp feel. Excellent hefeweizen style beer overall!

Bottle at home, courtesy of Eric. Thanks man!! Pour is lightly hazy golden orange with a big white head and great lacing. Big musty, lemon peel, citrusy, banana, clove, doughy, sweet bubblegummy, zesty aroma. Taste is banana, doughy, biscuity, fresh citrus, coriander, white pepper, somewhat musty, and clove with a big spicy finish. Medium body with high carbobation. Awesome Hefeweizen and hard to believe it comes in 6-packs. Nice stuff.

Hazy gold with a lush, foamy white head. The aroma is so stylistically perfect that its rediculous; lovely clove and cinnamon notes mix with an earthy clean wheat tone with a lightly dusty banana ester. Flavor is creamy and smooth, with a rich doughy body bringing perfect amounts of earthy wheat, pale pilsner malts, cinnamon, clove, and a kiss of banana on the bready finish, with a touch more clove. Ive never tasted a cinnamon note in a hefe before...I was skeptical about not only another hefeweizen, but RateBeers "Best" hefe in the world...but Im a believer now! This is an incredible brew, the benchmark against all other hefeweizens.

Bottle from Woodmans Onalaska. Pours yellow and cloudy with two inches of white foam. Lots of banana and clove on the tongue. Banana and clove are joined by bubblegum on the tongue. Its fantastic. Its one of the few that belong in the same conversation as Weihenstephaners hefe.
This beer is redolent of wheat and wheat character dominates flavor as well. There is a surprising level of acidity which is quite appealing. This is a considerably unique beer.

12 oz. bottle that I picked up in Wisconsin during my recent road trip to Yellowstone. Pours a mostly clear gold with a moderate-large white head that lasted through the first quarter of the glass and left partial lace. Pleasant aroma of wheat grain with notes of lemon and banana. The flavor has ample wheat grain that is complimented by lemon. Very crisp and refreshing beer. Medium bodied. This is one of the highest ratings I have given to a wheat beer. Excellent.

12 ounce bottle. Transparent gold with white foam that lingers as a residue. Husky wheat and lemon in the aroma. The taste is big and long lasting citrus and crisp grains. Medium bodied, smooth. Overall an excellent wheat that is bolder and bigger flavored than most within the style.

Big fan of New Glarus, tried this in a make your own six pack. Dark gold color and a bit of a metallic taste gives way to a pleasing aftertaste. Has some enjoyable spicy elements but Im not sure Ill grab another round. Too many other great wheat beers out there- but if you find it on tap in Wisconsin you may be happy with a taste.

Nice aroma of banana, bubble gum, and spices that is just right. Tons of carbonation on the pour, settles nice and slow...dark gold in color with frothy white head. Fresh wheat, sweet fruit/banana, and fruity spice gets cut at the right time with a spicy mild bitterness from the hops that finishes with a mild spicy, peppery burn that urges you for another sip to douse it out with the sweetness. I hope the hefe in my fermenter turns out this good.

Pours with an extremely thick head that doesn't appear to dissipate. Hardly any aroma at all (maybe a little bit of bubble gum?). High carbonation on the mouth - almost overpowers the initial taste. Once the carbonation fades, subtle undertones of apricot, bubble gum, and acidic battery acid. Reminds me of sticking your tongue on a 9 volt battery to check to see if it still has a charge in it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A very enjoyable hefe-weizen. Nice gold and cloudy appearance, with a nice head. Hints of clove, cinnamon and banana. The only complaint, that keeps this brew from a 5 score, is that it is a little watery. Otherwise, a great offering from New Glarus.
Bottled. Hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of banana, hint of clove, grapefruit. Quite bitter, bit sweet. Bit too bitter for the style, but i like the combination. Nice stuff.
Had an old bottle at least 4 to 6 years. And it didn't age well. Yuck. Need to try it fresh.
Smells and pourz like Hacket Pschorr. Taste is more bitter and metallic than expected. Gets better as it warms. Nice cherry aftertaste.

Bottle with Keith. Pours hazy golden with light head, notes of honey, lemon, clove, wheat, belgian spice. Taste is same. Body was too full and carbonation was light. Remember this being better a few years ago? Eh

12oz bottle

A: Cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. Leaves some residual legs.

N: Clove, banana, cinnamon. Plenty of malt sweetness through the nose. Peppercorn spice.

T: Somewhat spicy with a long bitter finish tucked over the malt and grain. Really nice for such a light beer.

M: Somewhat fluffy and filling/bready. 

O: Really impressive for the style. I think this would make Weihenstephaner proud.
Bottle.  Hazy pour with some head and a little retention.  Nose of yeast, cloves, banana esters, and fruit.  Taste follows the nose with a little bubble gum tossed in.  Good Hefe but not Live Oak.

Nice golden yellow and a big foamy head, champagne bubbles.  This smells great, with huge bubblegum and light cinnamon spice. So far so good.  Prickly carbonation is right up front, then this turns strangely dry all the sudden. Reminds me of a Duvel more than a creamy wheat. Dry finish and  somewhat on the thin side.

Hazy golden color. Loads of white foam. Lots of clove, banana, and cinnamon in the smell. Tastes sweet and spicy with a hint of banana in the end. Medium body, long finish. One of the best hefe-weizens I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet bubblegum and clove aroma.  Pours a cloudy light gold with a thick quickly fading foamy white head.  Effervescent and medium bodied.  Tingly on the tongue.  Flavors of light fruit and spice with a bit of yeast.  Velvety mouth feel.
Oh so good. Nice effervescence, just beautiful cracked wheat flavors to go with the "dancing aromas" of clove. Love it in the summer.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Re-rating 3 years later...
pours cloudy gold with a thick off white head.  Aroma of yeast and coriander spice.  smooth mouth feel.  bright at first then light spices creep in.  pleasant spices linger on the palate.  Even better than I thought last time!
12oz bottle. Pours a hazy straw yellow color with a thick fluffy white head. Aroma of fruity yeast notes, banana, and clove. Taste is banana, lots of clove, and some mild citrus notes.

Bottle pour - so interesting that it is 100% bottle fermented! Big white head, lots of carbonation, slightly hazy light amber in color. I did a firm pour and looks like the yeast are stuck pretty well to the bottom of the bottle! Nose is Nose is slightly bready, maybe just a hint of spice. Taste has strong notes of banana and black pepper and clove - beautiful beer for a warm summer day!
Bottle. Pours hazy straw colored, fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet banana, wheat, cloves. Taste is big tasty wheat beer, cloves, banana, light bubblegum, cinnamon. Crisp carbonation, smooth body.

Idk if I got a bad batch but I have never poured out a beer before  but this was crap it was so dry and the wheat was if it was just wheat and water I do mix and match 6 pack all the time I have never had any complaints till this.

aroma very fresh, citrus, wheat.  hops and grapefruit.
Taste is very sweet and citrus.  wheaty. very crisp and refreshing.  very light and smooth

Pours hazy yellow-gold with a GIGANTIC off-white head.
Banana, wheat, clove aroma....
Taste is strong, sweet banana, clove.
Excellent.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 Clear golden with huge frothy white head. Classic Hefeweizen aroma..not extremely bold. Full flavored medium body. NOT watery or thin whatsoever. Creamy and wonderful. Flavor is downright delicious - everything this style should be.
Seriously tasty, maybe even a little overwhelming. Sticky and full flavored, banana and lemon.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Super refreshing and with well-balanced banana and clove notes. Really great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Does New Glarus make bad beer?  Ive never experienced it.  Delicious wheat; a mix between American wheat and a hefe.  Less watery than most with a nice citrus body and some spice to boot.

Bottle from trade with Crajun.  Pours a slightly cloudy pale orange color with a big bubbly head that fades normally.  Aromas are sour fruit, bananas and clove.  Taste powerful mixture of the aromas.  Huge carbonation makes the beer foam up in my mouth, unpleasant.  The flavors are nice though and this is a somewhat unique take on the hefe.

This seasonal wheat beer from New Glarus brewery is superb. Pours a golden amber color with a thick head of foam that sticks around. Drinks very smooth and has a slight spice after taste. Dancing Man Wheat is far far from a whimpy tasting beer.
Pours a golden color with large white head, cinnamon hits the nose right off the bat, sweet and spicy and very drinkable.

Bottle shared by Dreadnaught33. Thanks Jonathan!

The beer is hazy, appearing golden yellow hued with a towering white head. Excellent retention and lacing. An all around stellar appearance. The aroma is sweet, with prominent banana scents. Very nice flavor, albeit sweeter than is customary for the style, though typical of New Glarus. Lots of banana and sweet malt. Not as refreshing or quaffable as a lighter, traditional hefeweizen, but certainly tasty and delicious. Light to medium bodied, with alcohol content well disguised. Wow, this is 7.2%? Overall, quite enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this beer. Another gem from New Glarus.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-06-2011

Clear until I poured in the last half inch, and then it went mildly hazy. Very good fruit--pineapple, orange--with happy spices, perfect for autumn, and an excellent complement to food. Not especially vigorous in the body; the beer fizzed up big-time on the pour and I like a beer to hold a little more back. Still, solid beer. Bottle.
From bottle. One of the better hefeweisens out there in the U.S. Good thick chunky foam and rich coloring in the glass. Surprising alcohol strength. $10/6-pack
Banana aroma with a huge head.  Clear golden pour.  No lace.  Taste is mild with a little banana and wheat.  Some sugar.  Not overly sweet.  Balanced and refreshing.

Bottle from PUBR.  Pours chill hazy golden with 2-finger fluffy head. The head is loud and boisterous, and says to me, "Byron Leftwixh sucks."  Well, I agree.  Nose is Belgian triply, with funky yeast esters, hopcitrus, florals, and orange marmalade.  Tastes of dry florals, yeasty esters, some clovey spicy notes, and a complex finish.
VERY lively carbonation.  Spicy aroma.  Cloudy pour that seems to glow.  Citrus.  Tingly but smooth carbonation.  Spice.  Banana.
A very solid wheat. A little heavier than normal with much more body. A good beer for when the air starts to get a little cooler.
12 ounce bottle.  Thanks for the trade Kevin! Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a decent white head.  Aroma of banana, spices, and wheat.  Taste is wheat, yeast, bananas, cloves, and lemon.  Superb!

Bottle. Pours hazy orange light amber with a large white head that dissipates with some lacking. Aroma is perfect hefe -	wheat, banana, lemon. Flavor is much the same with a light note of cloves. Lightly sweet with a lemony, yeast finish.

Bottle thanks to Joe. Pour pale yellow pour, pretty clear for the style, white head. Aroma of banana, definitely some spice but not the usual cloying clove aroma, much more balanced with a bit of cinnamon and clove, lots of fresh wheat aroma. Taste is slightly spicy, fruity, lots of very fresh wheat, slightly bready, yeast is present without being dominant. Super good balance, well calibrated.

bottle.
hazed orange.
vibrant and strong nose of crushed black pepper and banana.
medium-light body, silky carbonation, firm texture.
strong black pepper and gravel / mineral flavor.
strong banana notes.
well-attenuated, dry.
rich, peppery, creamy.

Pours a hazy golden color with a thick and creamy white foam head. Foam stayed in a cloudy peak for a few minutes and left good sticky lacing behind. The aroma is sweet bubblegum, banana and clove. The flavor is sweet and yeasty with great fruit and spice from the yeast. It finishes refreshing and mellow with a good lemony and clove flavor. A very nice rendition of the classic German hefeweizen style. A great summer or fall beer!

Thanks to Steasy66 for the trade!
Pours a cloudy lemon yellow with a billowy white head. 
Fresh malt aroma with banana esters.
The flavor is crisp sweet and fruity. Very nice!
Given as an extra, thanks dunt.  Orange pour with little head.  Smell of yeast, wheat, corn, slight peppercorn spice on the finish. Top notch hefe
From a bottle. Rich spicy and fruity flavor with a good yeast kick. Really good well rounded beer. Top notch hefeweissen.

Friends brought down six pack from WI - whats not to love here?  I got slight lemon and grass in aroma; cloudy hazy yellow gold pour. gave this a perfect 5 for palate - it was acutally creamy?  wouldnt be the best wheat to drink at 110 degrees but this was great in early fall.  flavor had some banana malt in it (said it was creamy) and sweetness at end - great wheat!!

glassware: generic pilsner...occasion: first ever New Glarus--a gift from Jaime and Jarrett (many thanks!)...aroma: clove and banana empower the nostrils--and banana wins the battle...appearance: thick, foamy head that oozes from the bottle--no lacing at all in its descent; opaque, tawny body...palate: mild-bodied, mildly effervescent in the mouthfeel; clean if not cleansing...taste: tart and zesty, as expected...overall: a wheat indeed--not overwhelming, but with some subtle flowering that peaks the tastebuds interests...

Smell is incredible!  Fresh, balanced, excellent yeast character, with some clove and banana flavors.  Color is a nice golden hazy color.  Man, this is good.  Lots of carbonation, creamy head.  Mouthfeel is perfect, head retention is great.  Everything about this beer sings.  Finishes with banana, clove, and a chalky note.  The flavors arent all that different then other wheat beers, they just really come together fresh and meld so nicely.  Finish also is tart and faint of hops with some cider apple flavors.  There arent any weak spots in this cowboy.

12oz bottle from casanova liquor Hudson WI, For a style I really dont care for this is as close to perfect as it could get. the mouthfeel and hazy appearance just awesome, seriously the creamy full body on this beer rocks. taste is smooth and rich with clove.. i was dancin after this

Poured into a wheat beer glass. Nice thick white head. Cloudy dark yellow color. The scent is mostly banana and clove. I dont get much else. Taste is also primarily banana with heavy clove & cinnamon. The clove is almost overpowering. Nice palate with good carbonation. Overall Im a little disappointed which is rare for New Glarus beers. Its an OK hefewizen but not well balanced.

Super hazy golden coloured body with a soapy, dense tan head about 5 centimetres tall. Aroma of wheat, corn, yeast, hay, grass and a good coriander seed freshness. Medium to Full-bodied; Great wheat flavour with strong hay, coriander seed, curacao, a pleasant sweetness and a bit of lemons come through. Aftertaste is very clean, with a dry note, but very refined and refreshing. Overall, a very nice beer - great to sample and superb for summer - I wish I could get this regularly! I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Trigs Cellar 70 in Minocqua, Wisconsin on 28-July-2012 for US$1.65 sampled at home in Washington on 19-August-2012.
Flavors & aroma of bread, caramel, spice & nuts.  Generous head.  Nice finish.
One of my favorite New Glarus brews, nay, one of my favorites period. A perfect hefe, bursting with flavor, perfectly balanced.

Pours a cloudy straw with 3 finger head that lingers for a bit, then dissipates. Bready malt flavors with bubblegum, banana, clove and a little lemon to it.. Mildly sweet a touch of booziness to it. Subtle resinous hop that balances the malts. Full bodied with soft, moderate carbonation. Long, complex finish. This is a great wheat. Cheers!

It really doesnt get any better than this as far as Hefewizen goes.  Beer pours cloudy golden with a big egg white head.   Aroma is spot on with banana, clove and esters.  Taste is sweet and the finish is spicy.  Absolutely fabulous.  I will have to drive to Wisconsin at least once again in my lifetime to visit this crown jewell of the MidWest.

12oz bottle from Three Cellars. Pours heavily hazed golden yellow with lively white head. Aromas of banana, clove, and bubblegum. Flavors of banana, clove, and wheat. Bigger body than a normal hefe. More of an imperial hefe but this is extremely solid as is pretty much every NG brew.

Poured into a weizen glass. 7.2% ABV? Imperial hefe perhaps.

3.0 A: This gave an unthinkable amount of head, but Ive been there with my own wheats. Eventually I ended up with a full glass. Orange brown color. Four fingers of pillowy white head. Retention is about average, but not a lot of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Tons of clove foremost. Banana and some pepper after that. Plenty of wheat. Great, powerful nose on this.

4.5 T: Big intense flavors. Clove, banana, pepper, and what are all abundant. Not super complex, but it doesnt need to be.

4.5 M: Lighter medium body. Good active hefe carbonation.

4.0 D: Really tasty and powerful beer, but could be a touch cleaner. Still, great.

Serving type: bottle

12oz bottle in Milwaukee. Aroma is cloves and cream. Delicious mix of flavors. Creamy, orange, spices, and wheat. Very smooth.
Pours a hazy gold with tons of head. Smells and tastes of bubblegum and bananas. The best here that I have had. Unbelievable beer
Bottle. Thanks to bnielsen13. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Banana, clove, wheat aroma. Wheat, yeast, clove flavor. Nice german hefeweizen.
This beer has a nice light golden color.  Not my favorite style of beer but this is a good tasting beer.  Has an interesting aftertaste.

Bottled April 14th.

A: A cloudy orange/straw colored body shows off some fine carbonation particles from the bottom of the glass to the huge rocky white head that looks soft as a cloud.

S: Mild citrus tart, bubblegum, sweet banana, and a very slight chalky aroma has good strength and is very appealing.

T: My tongue is greeted by a mildly sweet banana with lightly tart lemon, the mid-taste hints of some cloves, and on the finish a light bubblegum and chalk finish come in, mild cloves are left on the tongue after the beer is gone.

M: Velvety smooth body with light carbonation.

O: This is an absolutely fantastic beer, very well-balanced. This is something I would give to beer geeks and BMC drinkers alike to enjoy.

We officially nailed this style! This is the first US made hefeweizen that I consider on par with the Germans (and thats saying alot as I am a huge lover of German hefes). Aroma was big and full. Strong banana and clove. Very full and thick. Appearance was perfect Poured into a weizen glass, this cloudy light orange beer had swirling bubbles and a huge 4 finger white head. Taste was on spot and perfect. Heavy banana flavor with a nice yeasty bite and just a hint of sweet malt presence. Carbonation couldve been a tad more, but this was shipped halfway across the country so who knows how fresh it is. Regardless, one of the best hefes Ive had.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: The clove and cinnamon notes in this wheat beer made for a very pleasant taste. The orangish hue when poured leaves a nice impression in the glass. Very good beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy bright orange with a large white foamy head that slowly fades to a sudsy film. Aroma is citrus bready and banana. Taste is more banana and citrus flavors with good bread notes and subtle hops. Palate is medium and slick with a dry finish. Tasty!

Thanks to my friend John for bringing this back from his native land. Aroma is very gummy and spiced with sweet banana, clove and slight pepper. Appearance is cloudy gold with foamy white head. Flavor matches the nose; I do miss the herbal component in this beer. Palate is very bubbly and chewy. Very good.
Aroma is bananas, vanilla cream and lemons.  The flavor is lemons, tart fruit, an undercurrent of malts and mild banana sweetness in the finish.

Pours a cloudy golden with a substantial rocky, tight bubbled cream colored head. Nose is spicy doughy yeast with clove and pepper, honey sweetness, tart fruity notes, some champagne. Taste is pretty sweet with some tartness and a light bitterness. Palate is fairly full, vibrant, chewy if that makes sense for a wheat beer, with a lengthy tartness on the end. Very enjoyable and surprisingly strong. Great summer beer, though you shouldnt drink too many in the full sun probably.

Beautifull hazy golden wheat, white frothy head with excellent retention. Smells of bubble gum and cloves. Tastes spectacular: wheat, cloves, vivid bannana, and funky phenols present. Big buttery, and creamy mouthfeel. very satisfying finish. Best expression of style Ive come across.

bottle.  Pours a golden wheat color with a nice full head.  Aroma is strong and you get a lot of citrus in it.  Taste is a perfect wheat, nothing fancy, but sometimes that is exactly what you are looking for.  Solid offering from NG again.

Certainly among the smoothest beers Ive come across in some time. It pours to a monstrous, puffy head over a lightly golden and cloudy liquid. The aroma is a splash of cloves, banana and perhaps freshly cut hay. A lightly sweet finish makes this an especially good entry from the fine folks in New Glarus and an ideal summer thirst quencher..

12 oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange with a big frothy white head. Aroma is banana and clove, heavy on the wheat, a touch spicy, bready. Flavor starts with the same banana and clove note, picking up more of a fruitiness as it goes along, finishing a touch tart and crisp, lingering apple note with a slight bread flavor. Medium body and a crisp carbonation. Good beer

Pours a nice cloudy glass of golden perfection. Nicely effervescent, the head does fall rather quickly... Notes of banana and cloves, just the way it ought a be. Taste is so rich, but balanced, the balance is truly why it works so well. Nicely creamy on the palate without being overly thick, definitely adds a richness and fullness to the beer. I lived in Wisconsin for 13 years and I miss it for many reasons, but the beer is tops. If you can get it, do so, this beer is spot on.
Bottle. Banana, orange, clove, and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy orange-yellow with a moderate white head. Sweet fruity banana, clove, and light wheat flavor. Light to medium creamy body. Very nice.
12 ounce bottle pours a cloudy yelloww  color.  Aromas of banana, clove, light bubblegum, and some  citrus.  Flavors are the same with a light sice in the aftertaste, a solid Hefe.
This was a great experience. Tingly, sweet, beautiful. Everything youd want in a hefeweizen.

Worlds best hefeweizen? Probably. This was excellent. Hazy yellow colour with white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, grainy, sweet. Taste is like a banana cream pie. Amazing spicy lively palate. And this is 7.2%? Crazy. Great beverage.

Bottle thanks to lemonhead.  Hazy golden pour with a small white head.  Faded quickly.  Aroma was quite big.  Lots of spice, big time banana and clove, estery.  Flavors were bright and crisp, quite yeasty with notes of grape bubblegum and banana, some spice.  Mouthfeel was somewhat fizzy, medium bodied, danced on the tongue.  Overall a very good example of the style and enjoyable.

Originally reviewed: 11/15/10. 12oz bottle poured into a weizen glass. Pours a dark, über-cloudy gold. A thick, lustrous 3-finger head capped it off. Excellent retention; left light lace. Scents of pineapple, banana, bubblegum, yeast, coriander. Wow! Great nose! The mouth is moderately-carbonated, with a subtle bite on the finish. Moderate-to-full body. The fruity quality carries over well in to the flavor. Notes of yeast, pineapple, some mild breads, and faint spices. Well-balanced. This was a treat of a beer. Even "out of season" this would be a great, refreshing beer.

When I imagine a beer, I imagine something that will leave me with a memory. This brew fits the description perfectly. It pours a beautiful gold color reminiscent of a normal beer. What discerns this brew from the rest are the scents emanating from the brim of my glass. Odors of bananas and cloves take over the immediate surroundings of the glass. Since my first taste, all I can imagine is bananas and cloves. As far as wheat beers are concerned this one takes the cake....phenomenal!!

From notes.  First reviewed 9/3/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into my New Glarus Weizen glass.

Dancing Man provides a very large cream colored head, full of life and bursting bubbles. Initially it is actually a struggle to pour the whole beer as the head is very aggressive. The head slowly fades but still maintains a small creamy cap for the duration. Good lacing on the side of the glass as well. The beer is golden in color with the narrower parts of the glass being a little bit lighter. 

Creamy banana, biscuit and bready malt, and some clove and spice for good measure.

The flavor starts sweet and stays fairly sweet throughout. The malt is fairly sweet, reminiscent of biscuits and honey. The banana flavor is present the whole time, participating in the sweetness as well. The spiciness from the yeast creates a clove flavor, which serves as a segue into the finish, which actually dries out just a bit. The nice thing about that is that it prevents the flavor from becoming cloying.

Even with an ABV on the higher side for the style, the body stays solidly in the middle of the spectrum. The carbonation falls somewhere between creamy and crisp. A little bit sticky sweet.

Overall, this is definitely a top notch hefe.
Thanks to illismitty. Good ol banana juice here. It may be a little old and lost any hop flavors but Im really into this lager.

Bottle 12fl.oz.[ Courtesy of Secret Winter Santa ]. Light unclear medium orange yellow colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light malty, wheat, moderate to heavy yeasty, banana, light pineapples. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, banana, fruity. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20120211]

Poured from a bottle. Appearance is pale translucent gold with an enormous billowing white head of foam. Head retention is outrageous. Aroma is filled with notes of nutmeg, clove, bananas and bubblegum. In the taste is get a nice clove and bubblegum medley dancing across my tongue and fading to a wave of cinnamon and nutmeg with a faint semblance of banana coming through. This beer is mildly sweet and just faintly bitter. If the description of the beer didnt show alcohol content, I never would have guessed the 7.2%. Light to medium bodied, lively carbonation, and a long clove-esque finish. Thanks for sharing Weihenheizen. It is much appreciated.

I have waited for years to get my hands on one of the New Glarus Weizens, and with special thanks to Travlr dragging it across the Atlantic I finally have one. 355 ml bottle in Germany. Aroma is banana, clove, spicy/earthy tones. Taste is upfront fruitiness, lots of banana and clove going on. Strong flavors. Lively carbonation. Really solid hefeweizen. Probably my favorite that Ive had thus far from the USA. I normally am very critcal of Hefes from the USA but this one is almost perfect.

Pours a dark golden yellowish-orange color that is pretty hazy with a two finger, frothy white head that very slowly fades into a thick, lasting cap. Chunks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Spicy aroma with lots of peppery clove character along with some bready yeast, citrus peel and banana. The banana and orange/lemon peel notes become more prominent as it warms countering the heavy spice character. 

Full bodied with a really nice balance of zesty spice, bready yeast, light fruit and citrus. Like the aroma, there is a ton of zesty spice up front with a strong clove presence that lingers throughout into a slightly tart, dry finish. This is countered by the yeast presence that adds fullness to the palate and gives off hintsnof bread and banana. Toward the finish there is some more sweetness with a nice lemon/orange peel flavor. Excellently balanced, very flavorful and refreshing with no trace of alcohol making it dangerously drinkable. Probably the best American interpretation of the style.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of mikem409 - Pours a hazy golden color with a three finger thick off white head.  Aroma and flavor is cloves and banana with with some malt sweetness in the finish.  Light to medium body.  A good beer.  Thanks Mike.
Poured a nice hazy color and had some strong scents of wheat and etc. The taste had a rather pleasant wheat notes and went down smooth.

bottle from secret santa poured a golden color with a thin coating of white head. aroma has banana yeast, some flowery sweetness, and mild spice. mouth feel coats well and there is lower side carbonation. flavor has interesting banana yeast, mild spices, light sweet fruit, and wheat.

12oz bottle from David. Hazy pale orange, with an off white head that slowly settles to a thin layer. Wheat, bit of grain alcohol, lemon, nutmeg, bit of yeast. Smooth, medium to light body, mildly sweet, becomes a bit bitter and biting at the end which is quite nice. dry and a bit of depth as well. Quite like this - combines both an easy to drink wheat and a more complex belgian dubel or triple.
As us Germans say, "lecher" . Smooth, flavorfull, well blended quaffing beer.

Bottle from trade with a dude from BA. Massive white head. Nose of banana, a bit of bubblegum. Sweet malt as well. Taste is fantastic! Wheat, banana, lemon citrus, cloves & spices. A nice mild spiciness to make it pop. Very good mouthfeel, Medium and well carbonated. A slight alcohol warmth in the finish. This is the best American Hefeweizen I have ever had. If you like wheat beers, you will be hard pressed to find a better one brewed in the U.S.A.

12-oz bottle courtesy of James shared with Andy, Streets, James. Light, rust-yellow pour with a big, white head that recedes pretty quickly. Aroma is banana and intense carbonation or seltzer. Spritzy mouthfeel, high carbonation. Flavors are banana, citrus and maybe something like mango. Drinks almost like an orange juice or a mango cocktail.
Beautiful beer.  Soft tang, cloves, citrus yeast. Nice looking hefe...though less head. Tastes clean and creamy citrus. Mouthfeel perfect.  Could drink a crap ton. It is good to live in WI.

Pours a hazy orange/honey color with a huge foamy white head...lively looking...excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma has clove, cinnamon, light bubblegum...faintly fruity.  Flavor is fruity with light spice ag first but becomes earthy and wheaty.  Mouthfeel is silky and lively and the finish is dry and somewhat spiced.  Very enjoyable!

Pours cloudy orange with a nice white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, clove and yeast. Flavor is cinnamon, banana, clove and wheat. Has a nice sweet and malty finish. Light bodied with moderate carbonation.

(Bottle via trade with pantanap, thanks Kan!) Pours cloudy light golden-orange with tall off-white head in my weizen. Aroma of banana, spice, clove, citrus, wheat and caramel. Mouthfeel is light and wheaty-smooth. Flavor of banana, citrus, caramel and wheat with a nice pepperiness towards the finish. A little alcohol burn and bitterness sneaks into the finish as well. Another nice one from New Glarus. What else would you expect?
pours a wheaty orange with a fluffy white head. Nose and taste are of floral hops, summer fruits, wheat, and malts. Another fine offering from NG.

Bottle poured a cludy orange amber with a large lasting of white head with great lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, clove and light cinnamon. Palate was medium bodied and risp with a smooth finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, banana, clove and light cinnamon with a smooth lingering spiced banana finish.

Bottle from my local Pick-N-Save.  Pours a highly carbonated golden orange with quite a bit of head.  Aroma is coriander, bananas, lemon, apple and very belgian yeasty.  Taste is sweet wheat with some maltiness and some biscuit.  Strongly belgian.  Finishes dry and sweet.

SlPours cloudy golden color with a dense white head that remains for a while.  mells of nice spices including clove and coriander, fresh baked bread, bananas, apples, german yeasts, and slightly boozy.  The taste is wonderdfully complex with spices of clove, and earth, fresh fruity tastes of bananas, apples, and lemon zest.  Rather bready with cereal grains coming through nicely.  The finish is rich and yet dry

12 oz bottle
A: banana, tart, clove/spice
T: banana, tart, wheat, spice I really enjoyed this beer. A little to full bodied to be very refreshing, but so much flavor and aroma that I am okay with the body. More of a cool weather wheat ale.

Pours a light yellow colour with a thin white head and a nice citrus banana and clove light  caramel aroma . the taste is strong clove and banana light lemon and yeast and finishes with a bit dry fruitiness. all and all a good wheat beer.

Bottle: Pours a hazy orange/gold with a huge tight frothy head.
aroma is banana, caramel, light apricot, clove, yeasty, malted wheat. Very nice.
Soft body, very fine bubbles in the carbonation. Flavour is banana, lemony, grassy, get some earthy yeastiness, light clove spice. Outstanding wheat beer.
This is a great clean example of the style, lots of banana, caramel, bubblegum.  Very clean, sweet, lotsoftinybubbles.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2012 One of, if not the, best wheat beers Ive ever had.  It is worth the wheat!

12oz Bottle.A cloudy golden pour yielding a fluffy white head which settles down quickly. Aromas of wheat, yeast, clove and a faint smokiness. Smells every bit as a German Weiss. Medium body is creamy with just the right amount of carbonation. Flavor also very German. Wheat malt, yeast, clove and slightly sweet. Overall another amazing brew from NG!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Quite good.  Slightly tart and clove more so than banana.  Declined a bit too quickly as it got warmer but over all very good. Serving: Bottle

Really really good hefe.  Light and refreshing.  Grassy and wheaty up front.  As it warms you get a lot of banana and orange in the back of palate.  Never gets heavy or sugary which is key for a hefe.  Top quality for a wheat beer.

Location/Date:Bottle shared with Dave on July 29th.
Appearance: Pours a golden cloud.
Aroma: Aroma is a little bit of hay, earthy.
Taste: Light sweetness, some clove, cinammon. Really nice
Palate:Light-medium body, very short finish..
Summary: Wish I could get this more in DC...maybe one day.

Bottle pours hazy deep gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma shows notes of wheat, clove, white pepper, and what seems like a hint of cinnamon. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of citrus (mostly lemon), and a touch of banana. Overall body is moderate, creamy, and the finish is lightly bitter and moderately spicy.

Ar: Banana, peach, black pepper and clove.
Ap: Straw yellow and cloudy - big mousy white head with really good retention, very fine bubbles.
T: Banana character up front - segues into soft and full maltiness with a peppery finish - some peach and lemon flavor too - malt character lingers into finish.
P: Medium-body with medium-high carbonation - full, yet finishes quite crisp and dry.
O: Very refreshing and flavorful German hefe - nice ester complexity, plus the black pepper and soft malt is very tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2011 Pours a hazy golden color with a light head. Tastes like Banana bread, clove, yeast, happy. My favorite normal Hefe. Lots of spicy notes, thick body but still easily drinkable, hard to tell its 7.2%, its gotten me into trouble a few times..caution is advised.. Great summer beer.

And in this corner is the Wisconsin Walloper (Dancing Man Wheat) weighing in at 7.2% and in the other corner the Bavarian Bomber (Weihenstephaner Hefe Weiss) weighing in at 5.4%.  I had these beers back to back and rated accordingly.  Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass complements of cbfobes.  Pours cloudy golden with big white head that dies down some.  Aroma is clove, highly carbonated, slick texture, and great lacing.  Taste is estery malt (mostly clove, some banana, and a hint of cinnamon).  This is hands down the heavy weight champion of american hefeweizens, but weihenstephaner edges out this beer in my book.
Bottle. Pours orange. White head. Nose and taste of clove, orange peel, coriander, wheat and banana. Some alcohol and spicy hops in finish. Medium body.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 Bottle @ home, courtesy of the one and only Armin!! Cloudy, yellow orange appearance with a fluffy white head. Big citrus, banana, sweet, spicy, light yeasty, clove nose. Sweet yeasty, banana, spicy!, citrusy, banana, lemon, lots of clove, wheat malty flavor. Spicy, banana, yeasty finish. A quite spicy weizen thats excellent!!

Coppery straw pour. Big white head, with plenty of lacing. Fruity aroma. Bananas, slight clove, yeast, grassy and earthy aromas as well. Watered down banana taste. A bit of malt and yeast. Carbonic sharpness in the mouth, with a slight sweet and fruity after taste as well. Not bad.

Ah, Dancing Man, I finally caught up to you. 12 oz. bottle via BA trade. Pours a cloudy gold color with a small white head. Aroma of banana, clove, a ton of wheat, peppery spice, and sweet nectar. Flavor of honey, wheat, banana, lemon citrus, sweet malts, clove and other herbs, and apples. Light-medium bodied, with a sweet, citrusy mouthfeel. Wow, this is an awesome take on this style. Thats a sneaky 7.2%, too.

Aroma is banana, clove, spicy/earthy tones. Taste is upfront fruitiness, lots of banana and clove going on. Strong flavors. Lively carbonation. Really solid hefeweizen. Probably my favorite that Ive had thus far. Really hides the ABV well. Almost perfect.

Bottle from Sherm1016s beer fridge...just the top shelf, of course...thanks!

Pours a hazy yellow; just like a, like a, like wheat beer!  Thick heavy head that fades slowly....reveals a spicy nose and a spicy, fruity taste....its a little cold out tonight for this, but come summer, this will be a wheat beer of choice...another winner from New Glarus....

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2012 12 oz. bottle from Steves Madison

Ar:  Lots of clove and cinnamon along with a touch of banana.  Very spicy aroma.
Ap: Pours a relatively clear (relative to hefes) gold with a huge 2" head atop my weizen glass.  Decent lacing.
T: Fabulous.  Very spicy as expected, lots of clove and cinnamon, and the finish is predominantly clove.  Nice tartness on the finish, not overly sweet like most of these tend to be.
P: A bit thicker but not overly so at 7.2%.

O: I had to bump this a couple of ticks.  Phenomenal.

Spicy clove and pepper fill the nose, wheat bread, a hint of banana, lemon, yeast, perfection.  Pours a nice cloudy straw color with a hint of orange, thick rocky head with great retention, lasts for several minutes, some nice thick lacing.  Yeasty wheat bread and clove lead the taste, pepper, banana, lemon follow.  Bready wheat and fruity esters coat the tongue for a persistent punch of flavor.  This beer makes me feel like Im back in a beer garden in Bavaria, and is probably one of the best examples of the style Ive had in the US.

12oz bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits.  Pours a hazy, yellow-orange colow with a big white head.  Aroma is a strong banana smell with some clove.  Medium on the palate with above average carbonatoin.  Flavor is sweet, fruity, spicy, cinnamon, clove.  Im generally not a huge fan of wheat beers, but I could drink a lot of this.
Pours light amber with the clove and spice notes.  These drive into a more pronounced clove flavor that gives a very long finish.

The beer pours a medium gold with a hint of honey with a a finger head high that fades quickly. The lacing is light but small drops do cling to the glass for a while.

The aroma is light and just everything that you would expect to get from a hefe. 

The taste is nice, but light. Its lots of wheatness with a little sweetness to it, that separates and differentiates from most hefes. Its got a nice mouthfeel that is heavy and lasting and its a very drinkable beer.

12 oz brown bottle, the summer seasonal for New Glarus.

It pours into my generic Weizen glass a pale, light gold with orange hinting at the top and a ribbon of yeast. The head is foamy and massive, a white mountain brimming over the lip of the glass. It takes a bit to recede leaving some decent lacing.

The smell is almost pure bubble gum, there are hints of clove and banana, but mostly pink bubblegum. It seems to get more clovey as you sniff, but it has a strong bubblegum scent, especially when you sniff out of the bottle.

The flavor is more of a lemon/clove mixture, it has a deep spiciness that tickles the back of your throat. The mouthfeel is a bit thick and undercarbonated for the style, reminiscent of a weizenbock. The drinkability also suffers per the style because of this, but only slightly.

It is a wild hefeweizen, not quite authentically Bavarian, but pretty close.

Serving type: bottle

Poured from a 12oz bottle from Manny57.  Pours orange/yellow with off white head.  Aroma is spices, banana bread and coriander.  Taste follows the nose.  A decent beer, but not anything fantastic.

A: The pour is orange in color with an impressive (or maybe not?) level of clarity for a hefeweizen. A massive white head forms before subsiding.

S: Weve got banana, which is quite nice. But even more so, there is a lot of clove and maybe a bit of bubblegum. Sweet wheat bread is prominent as well. Maybe a bit of orange peel.

T: Very sweet malt and wheat with a bit of a honey flavor in there too. Quite spicy, especially with cloves, and theres a bit of citrus zest on the finish. Banana esters provide some sweetness as well.

M: The body is medium with a moderate carbonation that is fairly smooth and almost creamy.

D: Despite a way higher than usual ABV, this is a pretty good hefeweizen, especially for an American brewed version. Wouldnt mind having this one again.

This is currently one of my favorite Hefeweizens. I get a banana like sweetness and clove spicyness from this beer. Also, theres not much alcohol taste from this and its very nicely balanced! Definitely one of my favorite summertime beers.

Hazy yellow golden pour light ring of white head .... aroma of bananas hefe yeast and some wheat .... taste is the same fruity hefe yeast and a wheat with a spicy clove punch .... love the flavors clove isnt overbearing a solid hefe

Hugh rocky white head over a hazy golden beer.  Sharp banana clove nose with some yeast.  This is a very Bavarian wheat beer.  Clove spice, some banana and tangy yeast flavors.  Almost sour but not quite.  Very intense German Hefe.

Poured a cloudy orangish amber with nice fine head that faded slowly to frothy lace.  Aromas of clove & citrus with slight sweetness.  Taste of cloves, cinamin, bananna with a mild malt backbone.  Hoppiness was moderate.  Palate was nice with good density and mouthfeel.  Overall, this is a nice wheat brew.  I like this one better than their Kracked Wheat which has a strong bitterness level.
user_location: Town of Maple Creek, Wisconsin, USA

text: 12 oz. bottle; deep gold and hazy, almost muddy yellow with eggy white head fading slowly; sweet banana candy, light apple, fresh lemon, chewy wheat and honey on the nose; wow, one of the best aromas out there; heavy banana and almost bready wheat texture; light cloves mixed with heavy banana and sticky wheat; much more complex and rich than the SN kellerweiss in terms of flavor profile and texture; definitely thick and juicy to me, almost to the point of being a little much for the style; thats hardly a knock though as its so tasty; a knockout all around

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2011 Yay! Another New Glarus beer! This one from thetomG from Secret Santa Winter 10. Pours a hazy reddish amber color with a large white frothy head. Good head retention and lacing. Bready, yeasty aroma with stone fruits, pineapple and some peppery notes and caramel. The taste is fruity as hell, with tons of citrus,  banana and tropical fruits. Some yeasty notes and some husky grainy notes in the finish. A bit of bubblegum as well. Medium bodied. The yeast esters are running all amok in this one. Pretty good beer.

In short: A big body complex hefe.  This is not a lemonade beer.  Good stuff.
How: Bottle 12oz.  Exact age unknown but consumed a few days after receiving it from changeup45, thanks Gary
The look: Cloudy golden blonde body topped by medium off-white head with medium retention
In long: For the style the nose is quite intense with fresh green bananas, orange peels, dried citrus fruits, lime.  Taste has a lot of wet chewy wheat, yellow bananas (not green, not-ripe), apples, nutmeg, bubblegum, yeast, lime, light acidity from start to finish.  Finish has plenty of grassy noble hops with a spicy character.  Body is a lot heavier than your average lemonade hefe, and its body and lively carbonation may be its best feature.  Overall this was a very  nice beer.  A Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier it is not, but this is still a very much superior hefe.  Very nice beer.  Please believe me, it feels good to come hose after a long day of work to drink this refreshing beer and NOT have the cat lick my balls after I dipped them in milk.  Please believe me.

Many a six pack when I was living in Chicago and it was so easy to drive up to WI for some New Glarus.

A: Pours a medium copper with a very nice white head and a decent amount of lacing as it goes down.

S: Loads of banana with a bit of clove in there. A little bit of miscellaneous spice as well. 

T: Again, loads of banana, almost semi-roasted. Beautiful flavors all around, with a bit of malt sweetness backing things up. In the end, the yeast shines through, creating a lovely bouquet of German hefe flavors.

M: Fairly light with good carbonation and a nice, light creaminess.

D: The ultimate summer session beer, even though the relatively-high ABV will creep up on you.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-08-2010

Bottle - courtesy of zizzybalubba. Amber bodied with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is strong yeast, wheat, banana, soft bubblegum and candied lemon. Taste is big banana and wheat with heap-fulls of yeast and bubblegum notes. Soft lemon and sweet malt round this out. Light-medium bodied with exuberant carbonation. Ends with more yeast and wheat notes, light lemon, bubblegum and banana notes. Very tasty!

Hazy yellow with a large frothy white head that surprisingly didnt retain very long. Huge aroma of banana, clove, and spice. The flavor is big an banana, lots of clove, and has a bit of lemon on the finish. Medium bodied at best, moderate carbonation, and a nice crisp finish.  This is up there with some of the best German Hefes.  Thanks for the trade JB.

Had this one for a bit, bought it in the summer in Wisconsin.  Light orange, hazy, thick white head.  Heavy ripe banana nose.  Bananas and cloves in the palate.   Really nice American version of the German classic.
@Tampa Wkly Gathering @TampaPourhouse-12oz bottle-pours a white head and hazy gold color.  Aroma is light malt, spice, cinnamon.  Taste is sweet light malt, spice, cinnamon, drying.

12 ounce bottle courtesy of a friend (thanks Larry!) who recently made a trip to Wisconsin. Poured into a tulip type glass. Hazy, golden yellow color with a foamy white head that sticks around a bit. Cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon notes in the aroma. Bananas and apples taste punctuate the grassy wheat flavor of the beer along with the spicy clove and nutmeg flavors in the aroma. Lite bodied, lots of carbonation, very creamy and delicious mouthfeel. Extremely light, refreshing and delicious. The only thing that makes this beer not even more drinkable is its lack of availability where I live!.

Thanks to Exiled for sharing this bottle. This is one I have been wanting to try. 

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is bananas, cloves and wheat. The flavor is more of the same. The banana component of the flavor stands out the most, but the cloves and wheat are also present and keep the beer from being sweet and syrupy. Medium, creamy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. 

An excellent hefeweizen, one of the best I have had.

Bottle. 12 oz. Split with James and Vin. Pours a deep hazy lemonade yellow with a thin, foamy, brilliantly laced white head. Aroma of freshly baked banana bread, bubblegum, hay, fresh grass, cinnamon, pepper, and hints of mango and peaches. Medium bodied with a tart, zesty, crisp palate. Finishes with some citrus sour tart and a bit of drying. Excellent hefeweizen, and I typically do not enjoy the style.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2011 Bottle split with and courtesy of Pat. Pours a hazy orange body with small white head and great lacing. Aroma is banana bread and spice. Mouthfeel is light with great notes of banana, citrus - apricot, spice, clove, bread.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aromas of banana, clove and apple. Wonderful fruity flavor; bananas, apple, citrus and spice. This is an amazing hefe, very well done.

Pours a cloudy and muddled gold color with thick white head. Aroma is just loads of clove, with some banana, rich and delicious. Medium carbonation gives way to loads of banana flavor, which leads to another touch of clove and some wheat. A hint of bubblegum at the end, though an overall solid beer.

This beer is very delicious. It has a very crisp taste and is nicely carbonated. Flavors of wheat, citrus, fruit, and a touch of hops. Tastes like a true Belgian, but even more crisp. Delicious on a summer day, or anytime!

Appearance:  Pours a cloudy orange gold with a quickly dissipating layer of pillowy foam.

Aroma: Banana custard, light pineapple and clove.

Taste:  Clove, banana, orange rind,toasted wheat. Finishes with a slight twang, and some spicy bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Full bodied, aggressively fizzy.

Overall:  A wonderful, bold Hefe.  Lots of fruit, toast and bitterness.

A nice bready, spicy, sweet, and yeasty aroma on this hefe weizen. The color is clear golden with a decent head. There is a lot of flavor, sweet, bready, and a smooth but sufficient body on this strong wheat beer.

12oz bottle courtesy of maximum12. thanks, corey! pours a gorgeous, slightly hazy, orange-gold with a thick, creamy, bright white head and great lacing. aroma is wonderful with huge, sweet fruit notes of apricot, peach, pear, and lime zest backed by beautiful notes of clove, cinnamon, fresh florals and maybe a hint of red berry layered beneath light, toffee malts. flavor is delicious as well with an elegant balance of smooth, dry, wheat, sweet malts, and graham crackers with spicy cloves and sweet fruit notes of apple, banana, and apricot. palate is medium bodied with strong carbonation and a finish of dry wheat and lightly tart fruit. overall, a fantastic hefe.

A solid, but not overly aggressive pour gets a bit away from me such that I end up with four-fingers of light tan froth that I have to suck the top off of to keep from over-flowing my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip.  The head only subsides slowly, leaves quite a bit lacing on the sides of my glass and never fully dissapears.  The beer is a fuller amber color that shows a hazed, gold-amber hue when held up to the light.  The aroma smells amply fruity with notes of banana, sweet accentuating clove, some lime sorbet notes, perhaps some apple like notes, interesting wheat malt notes and a finish that reminds me of concord grape juice some how.

Slightly full bodied up front, but the finish sees a nice tartness become noticeable that helps to lighten up the finish of this beer quite a bit.  Up front flavors of banana are coupled with the classic note of clove that lingers in the finish.  The tartness in the finish brings out some flavors of apple in the finish, perhaps even a hint of citrus or lime that is more from the yeast and wheat than from hops.  Hops actually arent really a contributor here, which is as it should be, though there is a soft bitterness that is accentuated by a peppy carbonic effervescence and bite.  This definitely has the fullness that I like to find in a good Hefeweizen, but it is also quite a bit stronger than a traditional example, so it should be.

I will admit to wanting to be blown away by this beer, so much so that I was quite critical of the first bottle of this that I had.  This second bottle has settled in a bit better, but I have still had better examples.  This one is quite good though; and this might not be as fresh as the best that I have had.  In the end this is a nicely satisfying Hefewiezen; too soon I find my glass empty and I am wanting for more.

This pours a golden color with a thick fluffy head.  Scattered lacing coats the glass after practically each sip.  The aroma shows cinnamon, cloves, flowers, herbs, slight lemon and vanilla.  Not one seemingly overpowering the other as this comes together for a really nice scent.  The flavor mostly follows that.  Spicy but delicate.  Bubblegum, clove, spices, banana.  Slick vanilla backing giving it a slightly creamy feel.  Some hops that dry it out a little in the finish.  This is one of the finer wheats Ive had to date.  Tasty and refreshing!

I spend two months each summer in Germany (a swell time to drink hefeweizen), and there a handful that I think are wonderful, and the rest are a bit more dürftig.  I am AMAZED (and delighted) at having this hefe in the states, as most US weizens are kind of scary-faint imitations (if not bizarre aberrations) of the absolute top expressions.  Over there Schöfferhofer, Maisels, König Ludwig ,and Schneider are most satisfying, especially nice and fresh on tap, at least up in Hamburg - - big, rich, fruity, zesty.  This dancing fellow, over here (Madison, WI) is happy, happy solace, and great stuff.

Pours hazy yellow with nice stark white head from bottle.  Aroma is terrific for a wheat, big pepper, cinnamon, clove, and some candied fruit.  Taste is a great balance between spicy cinnamon, clove, and the candied fruits, finishing nice and clean and refreshing with a hint of sweetness.  Could drink lots of this, sessionable and very delicious.

12 oz bottle. Cloudy golden pour, big head.  Aroma is classic hefe yeast, with cloves, bananas, and cinnamon. Good carbonation, good body, very smooth.   Lightly sweet, with banana, esters and phenols and a light bitterness in the finish.  Easy drinking, but a light note of alcohol is present.  Overall, this is a complex, delicious, easy drinking beer that is always gone too soon.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2010 Absolutely perfect hefe. Huge ripe aroma of banana and clove and yeast, gorgeous hazy dark yellow color. Anything but the most careful of pours gives you a two-inch frothy head that last and lasts. Tastes just like it smells, with a bit of bread mixed in. Strong, about 7% abv, you feel it, but want to open another one. I cant imagine changing a thing about this beer; by style, its a home run hit onto Waveland with the bases loaded in the bottom of the ninth down by three. Yes, its that good. Afraid I ODd on it this year...time to drink Octoberfests for a while.....

Be aware it isbottle fermented, you want to drink this fresh and REFRIGERATE ASAP. Think of it as New Glarus Pliny. By December, these things have exploded on me. $8/6-pack in WI! I go to Woodmans in Kenosha.

I picked up a 12 oz bottle from the New Glarus Brewery, enjoyed while sitting around bored at the house on a Saturday watching college football.  Upon pour, this has a huge head, had to let it subside before pouring the rest into the glass.  Appearance is a vibrant gold thats cloudy with a large head.  Aroma of clove, banana, with slight hints of bubble gum and cinnamon.  This has an excellent mouth feel, not sour at all and not too sweet, balanced very well.  The cinnamon comes out a little more in the taste and the aforementioned ingredients are prominently displayed.  Im also getting a slight (very slight) backing of vanilla in the mixture.  This is definitely an excellent Hefeweizen, has a lot going on in a style that is one of my favorites but typically a straight-forward style.  This adds something to the style.

12 oz. Big nose of clove, spiced apples, and banana. Opaque, pear-apple cider color with a lasting quarter inch of creamy bubbles. Tastes of clove-spiced baked apples and bananas. Light-medium body is just a tad too fizzy for me, but refreshing and dangerously sessionable.

12oz bottle from DalzAle.  Pours cloudy orangeish gold with a one finger white head.  The nose is fruity esters, sweet wheat and malt.  The taste is peppery cinnamon spice, wheat, cloves and banana.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  Nice refreshing brew.  Id drink a lot of these in the summer if available here.  Thanks again Greg!  8/4/8/4/16
Every time I drink a New Glarus beer I immediately wish I lived in Wisconsin. Bottle, pours straw yellow with a big white head. Flavor is orange peel, banana, spice, clove, cinnamon.. wow. Delicious.

355mL courtesy of CaptainCougar. Pours a clear yellow with a decent white head that fills up the Ayinger weizen but fails to stick around and laces naught. Aroma is very intense spiced banana bread, cinnamon, nutmeg. Big hefeweizen yeast profile. Taste is a little slick and buttery, rich, spicy, full of banana bread and cinnamon, brown sugar. Fairly full bodied, creamy on the palate.

Pours a slightly hazy orange with a large amount of off-white head.  Light crisp odor with predominant banana notes.  Very crisp and delicious, a soft sweetness, and tastes of banana and dough and has a slight acid bite in the aftertaste, which changes things up nicely.  Very good.
Pours a light golden with a thick white head. Very fragrant, almost kinda flowery. Nice flavor, too, also a bit flowery, but light. Nice wheat. A little dry in the finish.
12 oz bottle.  Classic bannana bavarian style wheat.  Very good.  Straw color with a nice head.  Wouldnt expect any less from this brewery though.

Botle: Performed a Double Blind taste test between Dancing Man & Weihenstephan. First - let me say that Dancing man was the unanimous favorite between a party of 5 by a slim margin after comparing notes. This beer pours slightly darker orange in comparison, and the head is not as whimsical as the weihenstephan, I would say its more like hoegaarden in comparison, with less of the lacing. This brew does not smell "exactly" like your typical hefeweizen as other users state - a citrus note tends to shine through , with less of the yeasty ester banana feel and less of the funk. Flavors are very similar,  the citrus note is striking at first, but it moves into the more typical flavors of hefeweizen with that hint of cinnamon as well. It seems to taste slightly bitter at the end, and the carbonation seems greater as well. The moral of the story: You cant go wrong either way, and yes, as the bottle says.. sometimes you just gotta dance.

8/13/10.  12oz bottle courtesy cbfobes!  Cloudy light yellow pour with a fluffy white head that rings.  Huge banana and phenolics on the aroma, very sweet and spicy.  Huge sweet flavor with a dash of sour, ends with creamy soft wheat and a hint of vanilla.  Thick creamy feel, pretty sweet.

Bavarians look out! These guys are on your case. Poured with a huge, fine, foamy, frothy, fluffy white head and lots of lace. Color is a slightly cloudy amber. Aroma is classic Bavarian hefe weiss: yeast, spice, bananas, caramel, malt, lemon, fresh cut grass. Flavor is the same with great balance between bitter and sweet with some tang. Perfect body and carbonation. Ditto finish which is like flavor, of medium length and clean. Session.

Shakey Fest 10. To be fair this beer was pushing 80F when I had it, but that usually doesnt bother me. I will give it another try though, but I doubt it will make a huge difference. Peary. Clove.
