A bit too fruity. Just seems a little harsh and not easily drinkable. I dont think higher ABV hefes are a good idea.

Lovely straw yellow cloudy pour with massive amounts of foamy white head.  Very little lacing left behind as the head dissipates.

Aroma is very pleasant but mild (which is interesting considering how powerfully the flavors come out as you sip) with slight notes of wheat and spices.

Taste is fantastic - wheat, banana, lemony citrus, cloves & spices - its all here. Very very tasty.  Slight warmth from the alcohol, but nothing overpowering in the least bit.

Very good mouthfeel - not too thin, not too thick - and well carbonated.

I will be drinking as much of this as I can, especially during the warmer months.  EXCELLENT brew.
Poured from 12oz bottle, pours a hazy orange color with a white fizzy head, aroma is full of banana, clove and wheat, flavor is a nice tart banana and wheat, this is one good brew from New Glarus!

Nose was odd, hints of citrus and cereal grain. Taste was a shit load more tart than expected. Great funk and sourness to it. It tasted more like a berlinerweisse than a wheat beer. again, another fantastic extra from a great Wisconsin trader.
Pours a nice cloudy golden/amber color.  Almost a banana/carmel aroma.  Nice tangy beginning.  Slightly sour.  Great smooth finish,

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 Citrus & wheat aroma, but a little more potent than most hefe?s.  Flavor is initially  fruity citrus blend with mild wheat, and subsides to a medium carbonation & hop finish.  Medium body.

Big thanks to BarrytheBear for the opportunity to try this!

A-pours a dark golden amber in color, quite hazy and hard to see through, dark in the center lighter on the edges, tons of slightly off white fuffly and bubbly head all over.

S-tons of citrus up front, lots of oranges, fresh lemon, very fruity bubblegum, the spice takes over, awesome clove aromas with a hint of white pepper.

T-the flavors and balance in this are incredible!  this could be the best hefewiezen ive ever tasted.  the juicy fruit and bubblegum lay such a great foundation to only be balanced by a tasty spicy clove and white pepper, notes of a floral herbal spice presence with a light bitterness in the back.

M-great feel, soft on the palate, medium bodied and syrupy, strong carbonation to balance, slightly dry finish.

D-awesome beer, has the great balance of a wheat beer from the spice and fruit juiciness, light hop presence in the back with all of the carbonation and body you want to see.
First rating, courtesy of RJ and Janet.  Nice pour, with thin, lacey head.  Smells of banana, bubblegum and cloves.  It took a few sips to process, but liking very much.  Im glad I have five left.

Pours hazy yellow-orange with thick, creamy white head and some lacing. Fresh, malty aroma with plenty of citrus and yeast.  Profound body for a weizen.  Taste is oranges, clove a bit of banana and bubblegum.  Theres real burn in the finish and lovely bittersweetness afterwords.  This is a remarkable beer.

Ever kick yourself in the ass forever because an awesome beer was available to you forever and you never gave it a shot?  That was me with dancing man up until two years ago.  I dont know why Im just getting around to reviewing it, but here we go.  Cloudy orange pour with a big fluffy white head.  Aroma is tons of clove, orange,  lemon, and banana.  Flavor is up front clove, banana, pepper, vanilla,  and citrusy yeast.  Finishes drier than most hefes with some nice earthiness to compliment everything else.  I once drank a 6 pack of this having no idea what the abv was, and didnt remember the rest of the night.  Crazy that this is as high as it is,  I always figured 5%.

Tasted 7/22/10. 12oz bottle. Filtered with a dark golden hue. Off-white hue. Aromas of Belgian candy yeast and subtle perfumy notes. Bright effervescence and a crisp bitter lingering aspect. Bitter grapefruit and mild other various citrus fruits. Mild pepper, but more candy and berries than clove. German style with Belgian yeast. Wisconsin water. Orange citrus but more bitter grapefruit flavors. Fresh and very nice!

Poured into a weizen glass. Pours a nice large head (not very thick). Not very well with the lacing. Color is a dark straw color.

Smell is a very fruity. Bananas are the strongest noted, with touches of cloves. Taste is similiar and very great in that manner. I never was the biggest hefeweizen fan, but this really makes a person appreciate the style more. For some reason the taste of bananas in a beer is awesome. You can definately taste the wheat as well. One great part about this beer is that you cannot notice the 7.2% abv.

The carbonation level is great, creating a nice, smooth mouthfeel.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-05-2008 01:42:30

Courtesy of markwise. Pours hazy gold with white head. The aroma is grains moving into wheat, sweet banana and a hint of malts as well as some sweet apples and pears. The taste is smooth goodness with smooth sweet banana, bubble gum and some tasty grains. Into the finish the sweet smooth banana and grains come into contact with a faint rauch malt note. Wow! I love this stuff. It is full of flavor and complexity and easy drinking blended smoothness.

Bottle shared by ryan.  Nice looking pour.  Hazy orange yellow with good carbonation and light tan head.  Very aromatic with floral, banana, and clove.  Flavor is dry and slightly tart.  Mostly banana and clove, some lemon.  A little bit of yeasty funk.  Bitter finish.  Nice hefeweizen.

Pours a whitish, hazy yellow with a big white head.  Aroma has mint and herbs, with some spicy wheat and some citrus peel.  Taste is yeasty and herbal, with a bit of cinnamon, mint, and clove.  Medium sweetness with a bit of pineapple and banana.  Finish is mildly bitter citrus peel.

12oz bottle.  Large off-white head atop murky apple cider body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, clove, some wheat, cream, banana.  Taste is moderately sweet, clove, banana, cream, some wheat, lemon.  Creamy light-medium body with light acidity/effervescence.  Very drinkable, surprised that the ABV is so high (though it does start to show through when the beer warms).  Excellent.
In the bottle from the brewery store. Explosive white head. Deep gold color. Nice spicy aroma. Tart. Very Belgian. Nice citrus and wheat flavors. A good wit.

Great summer beer with a heavier Wisconsin touch to it. Im not really into wheat beers, but the wife enjoyed it. she rarely drinks beer. I originally rated it a total score of 3.0, but then saw the ABV 7.2%! I wish New Glarus would label the ABV on the package. When are they coming out with CANS!!!!!!

12 oz bottle in a trade with BA CosmoHopHead.  Thank you!  Pours hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is bubble gum, sugar, wheat, bread, and some berry/ fruit sweetness.  Flavor is very close to the nose with bread, bubble gum, sugar, wheat, and berry.  Finishes with lingering sweetness and bubble gum.  Very interesting beer.

12oz capped...thanks ughsmash.  Really, I thought Ive rated this already...I know this isnt the first time Ive had it.  At any rate, Im too lazy to go dig the bottle out of the recycle but Ive had it for a bit and not sure how long Jason had it, but I think I saw some 9s on the bottle so Im guessing it is almost a year old.  Pours a very light hazed, only cause I swirled the yeast for the last of the pour, perfect rich golden with a tight smaller unoform white head.  Nose is perfect for the style...light banana, bubblegum, wheat and faint clove.  Mouthe feel is perfectly carbonated.  The flavor is everything that the nose displays and very balanced.  Such a well made German Hefe...I am a NG fan boy.

Bottle Received as a regional extra in a trade with Brandonman 63. Thanks buddy you are a great trader!

Appearance: Nicely executed look...very cloudy golden orange color. Pretty much the same look as a Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier.

Smell: Cinnamon, clove, wheat, banana mixed into a perfect Bavarian Wheat Beer Smell.

Taste: One of the better USA Wheat Beers Ive ever had. If I close my eyes I can easily pretend this is the same wheat beers I drank off the tap in German Beer Gardens in the past.

Mouthfeel: A bit thin but typical for the style

Drinkability: Easy sipper.... Enjoy it all summer long!

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-21-2008

12 oz bottle. I was rather disappointed in this one. I guess I would have to disagree with the majority here because I felt this hefe was slightly off in several areas. It poured as expected with deeper golden orange cloudy body and a starch white head. On the aroma, some bubblegum, mixed spices, light cinnamon, clove, and a slightly off fruity wheat. The taste is also fairly fruity, lightly spiced, and some standard hefe notes of yeasty bread, banana, and mellow fruits. Full flavored and medium bodied, also fairly chewy. A bit too much soap/chalk through out as well. Not bad, but really nothing that special to me at least. Just an ok hefe.
Lots of bubbles, lots of flavor. I would hope this beer is as traditional as New Glarus says it is. It tastes great anyways.

Wow!  Here i was expecting a standard wheat with some flair but this is a whole different level.  Looks clean and bright with great carbonation and frothy white head even though this is an older bottle.  Flavor is wonderful, reminds me more of a Belgian wit than a Bavarian hefe-weizen.    The palate is definitely lively and "dances" on the tongue, a perfect complement to the light wheat flavors and spicing.  Crisp finish tops it all off perfectly.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2016 bottle-pours dark yellow hazy with a huge foamy white head.  tells me this is a bit oxidized.  a huge banana nose with clove and bubble gum.  a banana bomb?  could be labeled as such.  bigtime carbonation and lots of esters.  bodys big, but the huge amount of carbonation hinders the posiblities of this beer.  A very one-dimensional beer which i enjoy, but nothing like the copper kettle or other hefe they used to make.  however, i must have to try this beer fresh or on tap sometime.  
Rerate-I have had this brew many times over the years and it never is the same.  One of the batches I had a few years ago had a lack in overall character.   This one is big- bold Hefe dont know about the Weizen Bock label but whatever.  Huge banana and slightly nutty note probably from some toasted or caramel malts.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Bottle shared by John, thanks! Pours hazy gold with some cascading yeast and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice wheat note with a bit of sweetness and some light clove underlying. Flavor has a nice wheat note throughout with a bit of sweetness and a touch of clove backing.

A bright golden orange with a soft white head.  Clove ginger and cinnamon are abundant in the nose.  The combination of sweet fruit, banana, apple, sweet lemon and clove greet the taste buds on the first sip.  This is a very complex mixture of the fruit and spice that left me wanting more.  I am glad I have more; also need to save some for the next tasting.

Bottle.  Light amber color with a fizzy off white head.  Aroma is dominated by banana and cloves with a hint of bubblegum. Flavor is more malty then expected, with tones of banana and yeast and an herbal, clove taste in the finish. Medium-light body with perfect carbonation.  This stuff goes down dangerously quick for over a brew thats over 7%abv.

Bottle courtesy of decoman from TBS.  Thanks!  Pours a nice gold with a fizzy white head.  Very bubbly, nice lacing.  Smells of citrus - grapefruit and lemon - with a bit of an earthy feel to it.  Taste is crisp and light, but sharp.  Goes down very easy, would be great in the summertime rather than mid-December.
This one poured with a shortlived head.  It had the doughy malt aroma and tasted, with just enough herbal hops to balance.  It would make a great session wheat.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: 11th October 2008. GABF. Hazy gold beer. Dry palate. Smooth wheaty malt. Some banana tones coming through.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of skyview.   Pours a cloudy and golden orange in color with lively carbonation that creates a large, foamy off-white head that has decent retention.  The aroma (which I happen to like very much) is banana, clove, wheat with moderate caramel richness,  and bubblegum. The flavor is fruity with some bubblegum, along with some malty wheat, banana, clove, and a lingering rich and spicy finish. I was a bit surprised to see a Hefe at 7.2%, but there is no hint of the alcohol.  This beer also has a bit more body than expected, which is in a little contrast to how soft and mellow each sip turns out to be.  I have enjoyed almost each and every one of the New Glarus beers Ive tried, but this has to be close to the top of the list.  I wish this were closer and six packs were readily available.
Pours hazy orange with a big foamy white head. Aroma is yeast and hop spice and wheat. Taste is orange rind, wheat, peach, apple, and spices. Feels medium thin, but is very juicy, almost acidic.

Like a lot of New Glarus brews this has a nose and taste of bananas. And thats getting tiresome to tell you the truth. Cloudy pour with white Styrofoam head.  Orange peel and banana taste with a bit of an alcohol burn. Pass!

I confess, I love this beer. 12 oz bottle.
Pours a tall, fine head which dissipates quickly. Beautiful yellow-orange color and a fragrant bananas and sweet tropical fruit nose. The wheat and yeast flavors mid-palate with a lively carbonation pass to a spicy cloves with lingering banana finish. I confess that I bought three six packs of this beauty and drank all but two bottles before I got around to rating it. Its a long way to drive to Wisconsin for a beer, but I do it often for this one.
Bottle courtesy of BMan1113VR. Hazy tellow with an average sized white head. Aroma is heavy in wheat with citrus and yeast. Taste is of wheat, grain and light citrus.
A hefty Hefe made for the docks of the Northern Woods, pours like beautiful wheat cloud and finsihes big and bold
Bottle thanks to allendodd.  Pours nice golden color.  Thick white head.  Aroma of bubblegum, fruit, and clove.  Flavor was nice and understated. Nice wheat/banana flavors.  Excellent beer.

Served from a 12oz bottle given to my by my new brother-in-law. Thanks Jason. The appearance is a hazy straw/gold. The aromas are sweet wheat with clove and cinnamon accents. The flavors are full of creamy wheat, malts, cinnamon stick, pepper notes. The mouth is creamy with a slight bitterness.

Another NG from allendod. Thanks! I begin to believe NG is one of the best brewers. Thats based on a small sample of 2 til now. Pours hazy gold with a fourfinger white head. Aroma of banana ester and clove spice. Near medium body with frothy carbonation. Wow. The flavor reminds of Mexican chocolate - without the chocolate - so thats cinnamon. So much its like licking the bark. Clove and banana follow. A very flavorful hefe. Though the wheat isnt all that detectable. Just great.

12 oz bottle acquired via trade. Cloudy yellow pour with a thick white cap. Aroma of wheat, banana, clove and yeast. Flavor is a nice mix of those very same flavors, and it pretty much floats on the tongue, incredibly refreshing. Another winner from New Glarus.
Bottle thanks to thirdeye.  The smell is fruits, citrus, yeast, wheat, and malts.  The look is cloudy, yellowish, and a white head.  The taste is yeast, wheat, malts, fruits, and citrus.

12 oz. bottle from Woodmans Market in Madison, WI.  Hazy yellowish-orange pour with a foamy off-white head.  Luscious aroma of banana and bubblegum.  Sweet, but light, banana flavor.  No fancy citrus flavors get in the way of this one; this is a solid hefeweizen.  This is probably the  best hefeweizen I have ever tasted.  Outstanding.

Bottle via trade with rudolf. Hazy golden with a good sized white head. Aroma and flavour are both bang on style - wheat, banana, clove, yeast, lemon - and pumped up a notch thanks to the higher alcohol. Nice mouthfeel as well. Very good!

Pours golden and slightly hazy.  A lot of yeast stuck to the inside of the bottle.  Aroma sweet with a hint of bananas.  Well-carbonated.  Tastes sweet, but not too sweet, with hints of clove.  A good hefe-weizen, but not the best Ive ever had.
Courtesy of thirdeye11. hazy golden with a white head. Nice tart wheat, fruity estery aromas. Light body. Lightly sweet pale malt and tart wheat flavors with clove. very nice.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Thanks to thirdeye11 for this bottle. Cloudy orangish brown pour. Aroma is citrus, wheat and some noticeable tangerine. Flavor is somewhat of a let down compared to eh delicious nose. Wheat, some citrus.

Bottle with thanks to thirdeye11.  Pours golden yellow.  Awful aroma like bad bananas.  Flavor is alright.  Citrus with some spices.  Good mouth feel with a nice aftertaste.  I just cant get past the smell.
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  murky amber with a cream head.  nose is lemon, yeast and oranges.  nice thickness, flavor is coriander, lemon, oranges and a yeasty finish.  very well done.

Bottle thanks to BarrytheBear (BA)!Transparent gold, thin white head that dissipates near-immediately, rather tepid looking. Banana and wheat rule the nose, some minor citrus. Wonderful rounded edge in the flavor, the wheat balanced nicely with some sweet fruit and light spice. Lightly carbonated, perfectly drinkable. More enjoyable than Crackd Wheat, though slightly medicinal with warmth.

Bottle. Hazy deep gold body with a big frothy white head that slowly diminishes. Aroma of banana, wheat, bready yeast, clove and bubble gum with a touch of orange and lemon. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter and moderately tart. A bit of plastic taste shows up in the finish as well. Medium to full body, slick texture and moderate carbonation. This is a thick, rich hefe which is on the sweet side, but finishes nicely tart. Very good.

Hazy yellow with a large frothy white head that surprisingly didnt retain very long. Huge aroma of banana, clove, and spice. The flavor is big an banana, lots of clove, and has a bit of lemon zest on the finish. Medium bodied at best, moderate carbonation, and a nice crisp finish. One of the better hefes Ive had.

( 12oz bottle) Pours opaque yellow, light bubbles. Nose of wheat, spices, banana. Taste of citrus (orange), clove, sweet malt. Smooth and very drinkable. Nice palette linger here too. One of my favorites for an every day drinker.

Bottle from MrPickles. 
Bright yellow with the typical hefe haze.  A big, fluffy, foamy white head that sticks around forever.  Aroma yeast, bananas, and bread...and also quite spicier than any hefeweizens that Ive had.   Flavor is full of bananas and a nice refreshing fruitiness.  An enjoyable wheat beer.

As good a hefe as Ive had anywhere, I suspect. Ticks all the boxes you expect it to - banana, clove. Nice mouthfeel and bags of character. Great work. (Bottle courtesy of Oslo - thanks buddy - at the Milson Point park session September 09)

The beer pours cloudy straw color with a 2-finger head.  The aroma is spicey with strong coriander and clove presence.  The flavor is typical of a hefe with very strong clove presence.  Palate is about average for a hefe with a strong carbonation.  Overall, a solid but typical hefe, a treat if you like wheat beers.
Really subpar head for a wheat, only a thin crown. Scent is cinammon, banana, light spice. Taste is quite clovey and fruity but pleasant to drink even if this isnt my favorite of styles.
Bottle courtesy of Oslo, Ratebeer tasting under the Bridge 12/9. Hazy orange body, thick off-white head. Nose of clove and banana. Yeast and malt well balanced.  Smooth and refreshing.
bottled taste.  cloudy yellow pour with nice fizzy head.  aroma of citrus and cloves.  unexpectantly, a very rich mouthfull of cloves, cinnamon, and citrus.  quite delish.
bottle, thanks to bman1113vr, cloudy,pulpy, yellow color with a fat creamy banana aroma, flavors of sour lemon, citrus fruits, lighter spices, well finished, not too thin
Pours a clear golden with white head.  Aroma of bread, banana, citrus, malts, spices.  Similar taste, hint of bubblegum. Light, crisp, nice lingering citrus finish. A great hefeweizen actually!

Bottle courtesy of Lithy.  Sampled with curly at scottyps condo.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with decent ring of white head.  Great clean citrusy clove banana aroma makes the sweet flavor even more enjoyable.  Amazingly good for the style.  And not even a german brewery!  Probably the best american hefe Ive ever had.

( 12oz bottle, courtesy of BMan1113VR ) Pours a lightly hazy yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of bread, wheat, banana, light bubblegum, and clove.  Flavor of banana, wheat, clove, and orange.

Bottle
Unfortunately, I think this sample is a bit old, as the head disappeared rather quickly. There was very little of the traditional Bavarian Hefeweizen flavor or aroma.  The beer still tasted very good, but it clearly has seen better days. Until I saw this listing, I had no idea it was 7.2% abv, which is an absolute shock because you cannot tell,

Sample at RSRIZZOs tasting 8/9/09-Poured a yellow hazy with a small white head. Aroma of banana, cspices, and coriander. Taste the same with some more spices and cloves. This medium bodied brew is a top notch Hefe and hides the ABV very well. Great BREW.

12 ounce bottle- pours a hazy dark straw. One finger thick creamy white head with bubbly lacing. Nose- lemon, clove, bubblegum. Taste- has the classic hefe taste, but toned down so that there is a wheat zing to the flavour profile. Really adds to the refreshing nature rather than an overly sweet hefe. The body is spot on with appropriate high carbonation. Finish- dries out with a grainy aftertaste. Great stuff.

Bottle thanks to BMan1113VR. Pours a light yellow with white fizzy head.  Aroma is nice, has some banana, light bubblegum and lemon. Flavor is VERY nice, banana, citrus, wheaty malt, some bubble gum. Mouth feel is light-medium body with high carbonation. Overall, this is a damned good beer!
12oz - Aroma of banana, clove, cinnamon, doughy yeast and a touch of hops.  Flavor matches.  Palate is creamy.  A very tasty hefe and I could drink a lot more of.
Bottle courtesy of BMan1113VR.  Clouded yellow. Banana nose with zesty spices. Some citrus bite that sits well on the palate. Fairly tasty.

Bottle via a trade with iowaherkeye. Pours with a hazy golden body and a quick to fade white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, butterscotch, rotten orange and light clove. Taste is balanced with sweet vanilla, clove, banana and other spices. Creamy mouthfeel.
Lightly hazy yellow, white head.  Clove aroma, oranges.  Taste is more oranges, clove, light wheat sourness.

Bottle from Steves Liquor in Madison, WI.  Hazy gold, nice fluffy white head, a bunch of visible carbonation.  Nose takes me back to sitting in a sunny biergarten in Stuttgart.  Bubblegum, spicy hop notes, clove, toasty (very lightly bready?) malt.  Flavor is clove, light astringency (Almost hairspray), bubblegum, awesome toasty malt which is somehow juicy - if that makes sense.  Lots of spice comes out towards the finish - clove & other tingly things I cant quite describe.  Really great.  Highly carbonated & perfect for the style.

courtesy of solan.
pours golden, white head.
Aroma and flavor, nice yeasty palate, strong wheat/cereal palate with hints of bitter sweetness.
Would lvoe to try it again.

Thanks to hophead22 for this one. Poured into a weizen, light golden color and good head. Nice aroma of banana and some spices. Really nice taste. Banana, wheat, little grassy, spices and a touch of hops. Light in texture, really easy to drink. Overall, I wish I had more! Great summer brew...Thanks tim!

12 oz bottle courtesy of Roys Singles Selection (New Glarus, WI). Pours a golden glowing hue, big bright white bubbly head that dies to a decent layer, laces fairly well, cakey, well hazed body. Aromas are pretty estery off the bat with banana, clove, lemon, and flaked wheat maltiness with a touch of that bitterness it gives off. Initial is very flavorful, banana and clove forward and a good authentic Weizen feel with a touch of lemon, faint cinnamon, white flaked wheat and a decent bitterness on the backend instead of slipping into a watery dull finish. An assertive weisse, certainly flavorful, and at 7.2% it packs a bit of a punch, although it seems well hidden enough further into the body. body is light, yet smooth, creamy and coats flavors well. I enjoyed this, although it may be a touch strong for everyday drinking, which is how I generally envision a Hefe, sessionable and an everyday affair. Good. Very good.
Pours murky yellow with a white head.  Aromas of banana cream pie.  Flavors of banana and spicy clove.  Very nice wheat.
Deep yellow hazy pour with white head. Nice aroma of cloves. The flavor is cloves, malt. I found it refreshing and very tasty. A very nice beer on a warm day.

[2405-20090801] Bottle. Sweet floral wheat aroma has little cloying hints. Clear, yellow body with a quick bubbly white head. Floral wheat flavour is sweet. Light-medium body. Good.
(w/ others @ BCTC; Cooperstown, NY)

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a two finger off white head.  Good lookin brew.  Notes a pear yeast esters,  pepper,  cinnamon, banana and clove.  A great beer.  Very satisfying.  Wish this was available everywhere.  Some banana sweetness.  Very tasty. This beer left me with a smile on my face.  Want more!

Bottle that was leftover at BCTC so it came home with me when no one else wanted it.  So thanks to whomever it was that abandoned this one.  Pours a hazy golden amber with a medium white head that falls off a little too soon.  Nice banana tones and big yeast, with just a touch of spice.  Medium body, nice yeasty banana and gumball flavors.  Finishes with a faint touch of alcohol, fruit, and a nice tingly spiciness.  Balanced and subtle.  Quite tasty.

Bottled sample shared with oakbluff. Medium gold in colour with a bit of haze and strong carbonation. Aromas of clove, wheat, and a bit of bubblegum. More wheat malt flavor in the mouth, along with some floral notes, lemon rind, banana, and bubblegum. Light bodied and very refreshing considering the stronger than average abv. Very nice.

Pitcher @ State Street Brats in Madison. Classic hefe look and smell - hazy yellow with rally powerful banana and dusty wheat. Flavor is crisper/more citrus than the appearance would let on. Really nie banana/clove blending into a hoppy white pepper spice. Really well balanced fruit esters and bitterness. I miss being close to NG...

12 oz bottle.  Color is an orange yellow with fair carbonation and a nice tight head.  Aroma is big on the banana with back notes of wheat and orange.  Its a lighter medium bodied brew with banana and clove coming out first, then a hint of citrus and hop spice and ending with a mild bitterness.  This is a very well done Hefe.

12oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.

Pours a slightly hazy golden with a couple bubble streams coming up from the bottom.  Theres a big billowy white head that recedes pretty quickly and leaves almost no lacing.

The aroma is wonderful, starting with the mixture of banana and cotton candy sweetness.  There are hints of clove in the nose and a light lemony citrus presence.  Textbook hefe aroma for me.

The taste starts out with a much more tart lemony kick than I was expecting and the wheat sweetness is much more understated in the taste.  The finish has the tartness of the lemons combined with a light spiciness that lingers on the tongue a little while.

The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and I would never, never have thought it was 7.2% ABV.  Good carbonation.

This is an excellent and super drinkable wheat beer, though Id probably rate this one a notch below Crackd Wheat.  All I know is Dan Carey can make one helluva wheat beer and this just reinforces that fact.  Highly recommended.

2009-08-01. Hazy pastel yellow body with a foamy white head. tart wheaty aroma, sweet esters. (7+) Flavour is sweet, wheaty with malty touches, tart wheat, sweet estery character is pleasant. Subtle, Id like to return to this in greater quantity at some point. Average plus bodied palate. Pretty solid wheat beer. Bottle at BCTC 2009
Poured from bottle golden color with a medium white head. Smell is of wheat and a little citrus in there as well. Taste was about the same. Overall an okay beer

12oz bottle courtesy Ughsmash. Pours a hazy dark yellow golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of banana, coriander, wheat, yeast, bread, honey, hints of citrus. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of bread, yeast, grain, banana, coriander, spice, light caramel and honey notes. Generally light to medium body with a pleasing lightly spicy finish.
Bottle.  Pour is cloudy copper with medium thicker head.  Aroma is wheat, banana, clove, spice, and chamomile.  Flavor is true to nose and pretty rich for a hefe.  Nice beer.

soft estery nose of easy going supple fruits including peach and banana. appearance is standard clouded gold. flavor is equal parts spicy (pepper), fruity (aforementioned banana with the lightest wink of booze that curls around your tounge like a bearskin rug. mouthfeel also reflects that last note, while the typically soft weizen feel remains strong beneath it all. rich ABV makes this over the top hands down one of the best wheats in the US.  also a contender worldwide.  thank god i live near wisconsin.

12 oz bottle. Wow kick ass job NG. Pours a cloudy vibrant yellow gold with a creamy white head. Banana, spice and citrus aroma. Nice wheaty flavor with notes of banana, citrus and spice. Lingering fruity finish; smooth, creamy mouth feel. Impressive, up there with their unplugged imperial wiezen.

12 oz bottle courtesy of secret santa. Thanks Rudy. Pours a cloudy dark yellow color with a medium white head that soon recedes to a fine film. The aroma is moderate in strength with spices and banana. The flavor is rubust wheat with banana, bubblegum, rock candy, cloves and yeast. The mouthfeel is full and buttery. The finish is long with lingering cloves. Overall: A very tasty hefe.
Sample at the brewery. Hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Slight banana aroma with some cloves. More banana and cloves, very smooth, tasted good on a warm day.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Thanks to my buddy Kite for bringing this back from Cheeseland.  Poured a nice orange color with a decent white head.  Big and bold aroma of clove, banana, and yeast.  Flavor is much the same, nice spice throughout, this Hef doesnt mess around.  Really great Hef, and by far the best American version.  This gives Weihenstephaner a run for its money.

Bottle thanks to stfun.  Pours a pale straw golden yellow with thick white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma obvious of wheat, slight hops, citrus, and banana.  Flavor matches well and is pretty smooth and well balanced.  Mouthfeel is dry and leaves a lasting wheat flavor in the mouth.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2009 Bottle via trade.  Slightly hazy golden yellow pour with a nice white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, and wheat.  Flavor is great, wheaty and lightly spiced with banana/clove present, and some hops too.  Medium-light bodied and refreshing.  An excellent example of the style.

From a 12 oz bottle obtained in a great trade with Erik of Indiana, this poured a cloudy golden yellow with a medium white head and good lacing.  Nose is powerfully of banana and ripe fruit. Smooth and enjoyable mouthfeel.  Flavor is full of banana and cloves. A really well made and highly enjoyable hefeweizen, and one of the best I have ever had. and for sure the best one made in the US that has crossed my lips.
This is my favorite wheat beer. It has so much fruit and spice in the flavor. The higher abv can get you when polishing off a sixer of this but , hey its called dancing man right?

12oz bottle. Pours golden yellow with a fizzy white head. Lots of carbonation. Nice head retention. Aroma is of banana, spice, wheat, and citrus. Aroma is great and smells very inviting. Taste is of banana, spice, wheat, and some pepper. Lots of citrus in the brew as well. Each sip finishes with lots of spice and banana. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy, and heavily carbonated. Lingering taste of wheat and pepper. Slight alcohol burn on the finish as well. Very drinkable and tasty.
bottle thanks to jjclark poured yellow to gold and cloudy with great carbanation aromas of clove,spice almost like a wit flavors of clove,wheat,hops and spice very nice

Hazy yellow pour.  Aroma is lightly bananaish with a soft peachiness as well.  Light wheaty tartness as well.  Soft, sweet, wheaty malt base.  A bit of light spiciness on the back.  The body is quite full-bodied and lovely.  A kiss of bubble gum, fruity peach and banana.  There is less spice than is typical and a bit more fruitiness.  Its a pretty solid hefe.

This is as good a wheat as Ive ever tasted, and that includes German wheat beers. You heard that correctly. Pours a lovely hazy, golden color with a nice thick head. The aroma is strong in citrus, clove and other spices. Flavor is complex, fruty, spicy, with the clove and banana flavors one finds in a good weissbeer.

Pours very hazy gold with a tall, rocky off white-yellow head that has great retention. Aroma is huge on bubblegum, banana, cloves, yeast, wheat bread, lemon tart and vanilla pudding. Flavor is sweet malt, wheat, banana taffy, clove, a little pepper, cinamon stick, tart red apple, lemon poppyseed bread, citrus notes and some bread dough. Finish is yeast, spice and wheat. Palate is thin to medium bodied. Creamy on entry leading to a viscous, chewy middle and dry, slightly chalky, but clean finish. This is really fantastic stuff, the best hefeweizen that I remember having and yet another AMAZING wheaty brew from New Glarus.

Bottle sent by MOTORTODDHEAD. Thanks my friend.  Pours a cloudy gold color.  Bananas all over the nose and some coriander, cloves and yeast.  Flavor is really nice.  Banana, clove, nutmeg, yeast and wheat.  Smooth and rich.  Nice mouthfeel.  One of the better wheats I have had.  NICE!
BOTTLE: cloudy gold pour, clove and banana on taste. Belgian spices, coriander, wheat - this is probably the best Hefeweizen Ive had.

German-style hefe if there was one but the yeast character is too much for my tastes. Big clove, cinnamon character with little to balance it out. Like dipping your nose into a spice jar, which is not the kind of experience I wish to equate with beer drinking.

12 oz bottle.  Im not sure why I havent gotten around to rating this yet.  Pours a hazy gold with large, frothy white head that leaves abundant lacing as it fades.  The nose has huge amount of banana and cloves with some other fruity esters as well as wheat.  Flavors are much the same with some added candy sugar and a luscious mouthfeel.  Goes down oh so smoothly.  Alcohol is not really noticeable.  One of my favorite hefes.
Nice wheat beer.  I prefer the cloudy hefe style, but medium gold color and a nice white head.  I experienced the banana-clove aroma and flavor.  No hop aroma, very little hop bitterness.
good banana aroma, clove aroma, clean and sweet. a little too sweet and affecting texture (tacky), delicious though and beautiful in the glass

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2011 Bottle - Pours clear amber with a massive white head. Smells like a spicy, sweet banana. The taste Im not that crazy about--its all wheat and spice, but nothing out of the ordinary. Its smooth and medium bodied. This beer looks and smells so much better than it tastes, so Im a bit disappointed. I liked the Unplugged Imperial Weizen way better.
Update 9/11/11 - After going through multiple cases of this the last couple years, Id have to say either my tastes have changed, the recipe has changed, or both. This hefe is up there with the big boys, with pungent aroma and flavor, and none of the over-spiciness that I tasted back in 2009. Fantastic on a hot summer day, though the newly-released Laughing Fox might be a better choice if youre going to session. 7.2% is a bit much for that purpose.

12oz Bottle - Trade - JJClark
Aroma: Big wheat aroma with the banana and clove aroma coming out strong.  
Appearance: Golden in color, hazy with a thin head.  
Flavor: Huge wheat flavor this was thick.  Fruity and grapefruit flavor for sure.  
Palate: Dry finish, with a Good Mouthfeel.  
Overall: A superb hefeweizen.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2009 Cloudy straw with a hint of orange, large pillowy white head, fine lacing.   Now this is a Wheat Beer with a kick.  Screw that fruity stuff, this has spice!   Aroma of wheat malts, clove, and minor banana.   Flavor packs a whole lot of wheat malt flavor, some cloves, and a hint of nutmeg.   Clean, with a little spiced up finish.   Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full.   Not as heavy as many German examples, but the flavor profile is all there.   Probably one of the better made German Hefeweizens I have had.   Very enjoyable beer and I am glad that it is Dancing Man time of year once again.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2009 Bottle. Pours a very hazy golden orange with about 1.5 inch of foamy head. Smells a bit citrusy, but doesnt have much of a citrus taste. Taste is more of a light blend of cinnamon and clove.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow golden body with a white head.  Wheat, coriander, spices all in a very lovely balance, nice brew.

. wow, this is 7.2, couldnt tell til i got up from my breakfast... pours a dark murky tan yellow... great medium thickness foam ..2-0 to chelsea @ arsenal at the half... sweet banana, esters, maple, goodness in the nose ... . give him at least a week before you do something terrible to him... A pretty full/bold hefeweizen, but still pretty refreshing, but the added alcohol makes it a sipper ... . not that personal .. A very nice brew and pretty well made, but i didnt flip over it as i do most New Glarus products..

Hazy orange in colour with a long lasting large white head, vigorous carbonation, excellent lacing.  The flavour is of lots of bananas, wheat, lots of yeast, citrus and quite sweet.  The flavour has lots of bananas, much like the aroma, lingering sweetness, yeasty, some bubblegum.  Very filling mouthfeel, medium body, high carbonation.  Finishes long, yeasty and very sweet.
At times I felt like I was drinking banana candy.  Very filling with noticeable alcohol.  Wasnt the thirst quencher that I was hoping for.
355ml bottle obtained in a trade with TheCheeseMan, thanks Dan.
Opened on October 4, 2008.
No date.
Alcohol is very well hidden. Smells like birthday cake and wheat. Pretty heavily carbonated, flavor is wheat, dough, some lemon, sweet. Really good hefe.

2008 Bottle - Thanks motortoddhead! - Pours a hazy orange with a decent off-white head...aroma is spicy dough, huge clove and pear/banana...flavour is similar, a bit of tart lemon rounds off the back end...really redefined my expectations of a german hef...booze is completely hidden, nice treat...
A very awesome wheat beer,  Very refreashing and smooth. Poured a beautiful unfiltered yellow. great beer.
Bottle. Hazy peach  with a light white head. Creamy wheat, lemon and clove with taste much the same. Some banana sweetness and light bitter spices.

Pours a clear yellow golden, slightly hazy, with a tall white dense foam.  Lighter very sweet aroma, touch of hops, apple, faint cinnamon and clove.   Sweeter flavor, bit of apple, lightly spiced, fruity bubble-gum, finishing a bit hot and with some ripe bananas and clove.  Watery body.

Bottle from Sammy. Thanks! Cloudy orange color with a big, very slowly-diminishing, white head. Good aroma of wheat, fruity esters (some banana, mango hints and some other fruits) and clove. Sweetish flavor with light acidic notes, banana, light spiciness, a bit of bubblegum, a bit of bread and light bitterness in the finish. Nice fluffy mouthfeel, A really good Weizen.

Cloudy pale golden in color with an initially large, but quickly diminishing head of white foam. Very nice aroma hinting of clove, banana and vanilla in a highly expressive manner. Flavor is complex and balanced very well. Notes of toffee and caramel, with a touch of golden raisin, and notes of banana and clove. Outstanding German wheat ale. New Glarus could be better than Weihenstephan at the style.

Bottle Bonus from StFun.  Poured a very hazy rich orange color with a little carbonation.  Aroma was rich with banana esters and left me want to do nothing but smell this beer!  Flavor of clove, banana, and pleasant sugary malts.  No question about it, one of my favorite hefes to date.  I may have to make a trip to WI to pick some of this up!

Golden and hazy. Very foamy and effervescent. Wheaty, sweet, nice beer. Very enjoyable and Id definitely drink it again...to bad I cant pick it up locally. 

Nice wheat...really didnt taste the 7.2 ABV...
This beer was just a little too sweet for my likes.  May have been a little too light of a beer for my tastes.

Bottle shared by emacgee. Thanks Ethan. Pours golden with a thick white head Nose is wheat, citrus, lemon, light tartness. Flavor is similar, with a good authentic hefe characteristics--clove, wheat, banana.  Dry and earthy mouth feel.  Alcohol extremely well hidden. Very enjoyable.

Ethan shared this one.  Hazy golden orange pour with thin white head.  Notes of banana, clove, grainy bread, and mild citrus.  Nice bitterness.  Jason and I disagree on this, but I could detect the alcohol.  Yum.

Thanks TheCheeseMan for extraing. Pours a nice cloudy soft yellow with a one finger frothy white head. The nose was very yeasty, earthy, clove, wheaty, bready, mild banana/isoamyl acetate. The flavor was similar, nice clove and banana character, very wheaty, nice earthiness in the background with a soft hefe yeast character. Nice full and smooth mouthfeel. Very traditional and lovely.

Bottle shared by emacgee - thanks, Ethan! Man this is just about as good as it gets for this style, one that I usually dont get very excited about. Cloudy pour, straw yellow, with some fairly decent lacing. The nose has an unexpected and wickedly satisfying tartness to it. Lively mouthfeel brings out flavors including clove, mild citrus, and honeydew. 7.2%? No way. Anyways, a delightful hefe.

Truly the best Hefe ive ever had.  Its not too much, but not too subtle.  I love the scent of cloves and cinnamon.  Beautiful straw color and lacing on the glass.  By far my favorite brew from New Glarus.  Its a definate must try for any wheat beer fan.
Just about the best hefe I ever had, In fact, the only one that comes close is shells hefe.  Loaded with sweet banana and clove. Just Frickin delicious!

[Bottle] Pours a hazy golden color with a large amount of dense white head. Potent aroma of yeast, bubblegum, clove and wheat malt. Taste is of light banana, plenty of wheat and more than average spice. Cinnamon and clove are quite evident in here. Excellent palate, with a rich and seemingly oily mouthfeel. Extremely drinkable and delicious!

12 oz into Discount Liquor/New Glarus shaker.  Effervescent and almost clear golden with ample billowing white head that mostly dissipates, leaving a mottled layer of bubbles on the surface.  Wonderfully rich and warm citrus smell, like freshly cut melons, swaddled in some yeasty sweetness that is not as cottony as I would expect from a wheat beer; it doesnt dampen the fresh fruits in the nose.  Nice biting carbonation delivers a dark graininess at first, before the beer foams up in the mouth and softens out.  Once it softens, the same wonderful melony sweetness from the smell dominates the finish after a burst of the mellow and somewhat-cottony wheat character.  The sweetness in the finish is lactic and mild.  No traces of acidity; this stays smooth throughout except for the initial burst of carbonation.  Unbelievable that this has 7.2%, it drinks like a very mild session beer closer to 4%.  As with almost all New Glarus beers, this one seems wonderfully crafted and flavorful, if a bit too restrained (at least for the hardcore over-the-top beer geeks).

This is a pretty high rating for a hefe, but it is definitely deserving. Has the very typical hefe aroma, pours a nice deep golden color with a big wheaty head. But what makes this beer great is the wonderful mouthfeel not usually associated with hefes, and the squeaky clean finish. I could drink these all day.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2009 Tap. dang it this beer had me dancing after a couple of these. It is fairly high in alcohol for a wheat and it is not noticeable. It pours with a hazy yellowish color. Complex of aromas of spices like cinnamon and cloves. Very spicy flavors of coriander, cloves, cinnamon and even some cardamon. These speices overshadow the yeasty banana flavor of a traditional german weizen somewhat but this beer is spectacular.

Bottle courtesy of Sammy. Great hefe. Pours a cloudy orange. Spritzy, orange citrus, medium body. Banana is less evident & I prefer this. Best American wheat to date. Extremely drinkale & delicious. Big thanks to Sammy for this gem

12oz bottle.  Cloudy orange appearance.  Solid effervescent carbonation.  Crisp lemony wheat mouthfeel, with a mellow hefe yeast banana finish.  Excellent American Wheat beer, could rival some of best in Germany.  Very fresh, brought back from Wisconsin.

Thanks to Adrian for a bottle of this  dark, cloudy hefeweizen.  The flavor is a pleasant surprise - a rich, sweet, fruity hefe!  Fizzy and juicy on the palate.  As good a beer of its kind as I have ever had.

Thanks Grant for bringing back from WI. My first pint (I will give it another go) showed abundant white head. The aroma was full of spicey wheat. Above average mouthfeel. Very sweet orangey, clove, corriander. Almost cloying, so I did not fiund overly drinkable. I remember more balanced hefes.
Pour is hazy light gold with minimal white head.  Aroma is clove, wheat and lemon.  Flavor the same.  Some bread too.  Palate is dry, and a little sweet.

12 oz bottle from KingpinIPA, thanks Mike. Pours a hazy golden orange with a HUGE fluffy bright white head. Aroma is strong with notes of clove, wheat, wet hay, green apple and a slight plastic touch towards the end. Body on this one was smooth but the carbonation was very light on the first couple sips but as the beer warmed some the strength was bolstered. Flavor starts off slightly sour with noticable fruitiness and more wheaty grass flavors towards the end. This was a good way to start off my Halloween night of beers and B class horror movies.
GABF 2008. Hazy golden yellow, banana, spices, citrus kiss in the finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Solid.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Clear golden pour with a towering foamy white head that dissipates immediately.  Sweet banana on the nose along with faint wheat notes.  The flavor seems to be that of a watered down german hefe.  I am not sure what all the hype over this beer is.  I will have to try it again and rerate if necessary.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2009 GABF 2008.  Pours hazy light yellow with a small, fizzy, white head, somewhat lasting with fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, grain, meal), light hops (herbs), average yeast (horse blanket) with notes of banana.  Light bodied, sticky texture, average carbonation, and a chalky finish.  Average duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.

Bottle 8/10/09: Rating unchanged.

Just about one of the most beautiful hefes I have ever had. Pours very cloudy and yellow, with a beautiful fluffy white head that sticks around with a lace to match. This is remarkably spicy, more so than most hefe’s I have had, the banana clove thing is cranked to 11 here and this just sings with citrus notes. The beer is a hair too sweet, but this is balanced by a big alcohol presence that dries it out a bit but does not get in the way of the remarkable drinkability.

Scored this in a trade with kmeves.  Thanks Meves!  Looks like fairly normal Hef, 12oz bottle pours a translucent, cloudy, unfiltered yellowish gold with a frothy, soft white head.  Flavor was very nice, right on point for an exceptional hef, cloves, banana, yeast, grain, grass, wheat, bubble gum, lemons and spice.  The finish is really what makes this beer jump, very soft on the palate.  Sweet finish, soft carbonation and a little chalkiness that envelopes the mouth.   Maybe the best Hef I’ve ever tasted.

12oz bottle.  This brew pours a completely hazed grapefruit juice color with no head.  Big nose of clove spice, banana, citrus and yeast.  Banana, lemon, and spice made up most of the flavor.  This is one of the best hefes I’ve had in a long, long time.

What a great example of a Hef.  Pours slightly cloudy with a very thick head.  Aroma is mildly floral and bitter.  Flavor is cloves, slight brown banana in the finish, wheat, flour, sourdough crust and lemon zest, but here is the rub: it is perfectly blended as if there existed a sour bread spice fruit somewhere in the wild plains of Wisconsin.  Very nicely done.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Todd.  Pours a cloudy honey yellow gold with a medium sized white head.  Aroma of bubble gum, spicy cloves, lemon, banana and honey.  One of the best aromas ever for this style.  Taste of spicy clove, banana, lemon and honeysuckle.  Superb !!!

Bottle into weizen:  aroma is strong of spicy clove and banana with some lemon; appearance is cloudy golden yellow with a pillowy white head that leaves light lacing throughout the entire glass;  flavor is strong of banana, clove, light bubblegum and lemon.  As good as it gets for me anytime.  Going to buy as bunch as I can get my hands on before they stop brewing it for the year.

14 aug 08: 12 oz
Aromas of clove phenols and banana esters, light malt, no hops
Cloudy, med yellow.  white head with good retention
Med-light sweetness, lots of banana and clove and citrus flavors, no hops.
slight slickness, sweet aftertaste, light med body, med carb
Nice Bavarian Hefeweizen.  A tad on the sweet side, but great flavors overall, quite to style.

great hefe pour, cloudy and golden with a huge beige head. Great aroma of banana’s cloves, bubblegum, a touch of lemon, and some cinnamon. Wow, incredible!! The flavor is intense, huge banana and clove esters. Wicked balanced wheat flavour, i love this beer!!

Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow color wheat with a medium foamy head with average retention and some minimal lacing. Aroma of cloves are dominating with some discernable wheat and overall a quite big malt base. Taste is a mix between some cloves and some big malt base and is not as close to the style as I was expecting. Either there is too much wheat and the beer is veering toward a wheat wine or maybe there is too much barley but I thought the malt base was too sweet for the style and didnt provide enough refreshment. Also, at the risk of sounding too traditional, I would have like if more banana ester would have showed. Definitely not the best weizen out there and probably over rated and not the best beer from a very good brewer.

Bottle. Cinnamon scent immediately after popping cap. Poured very nice showing off its rich golden hue as the head built thickness. Whew, what a taste! Spicy cinnamon with orange notes dancing in my mouth. Just a hint of lemon. Similar to Copper Kettle with a tad more bitterness on the finish. As good as the German hefes! Another winner from New Glarus.

Thanks NobleSquirrel!

lemon in the aroma...taste is quite fruity, with almost an apple cider-like finish, yet it’s still quite refreshing.  Pretty good summer beer.

This was one of the better tasting beers of this type I have tasted.  Had a bubble bum and pineapple flavor up front with a lingering aftertaste of banana.  A good choice when I have friends and family over to taste the best of a variety of different beers.

Bottle pours a glowing and ulta hazed golden amber with a big head that goes down slow.  The aroma is of fresh out of the oven banana bread, mandarin orange, and perhaps clove.  The flavor hits as clove and banana, wheat, lemon in the back, and a rich and cleansing palate that is awesome.  Alcohol is nowhere to be found in the flavor.  Overall, best wheat ever!

[Bottle] Pours a semi-clear gold with a really nice off white head that stays fairly well. Aroma is quite clovey, with a bit of tart wheat malt. Mouthfeel is just a little bit thinner than I would have hoped, but the flavor is very, very nice. Lots of nice yeasty flavors, banana, clove, wheat malt. Nice crisp finish.

Pour is hazy golden with a nice fizzy finger white head.  Aroma is very floral with light orange, spice, light fruit, a hint of hops, and medium wheat.  Flavor was quite sweet with strong floral characters moving to a hint of clove and finishing slightly dry but still sweet with some yeasty notes.  Very well blended brew.  Carbonation was only slightly rough but overall, damn good brew.  Worth the buy for sure.  Stands up nice in the style of hefe-weizens.

This one pours cloudy golden with a monster head that hangs out for a good 5 minutes.  Aroma is sweet fruit esp bannana and wheat.  Flavor is outstanding easily the best hefe I’ve ever had.  Bannana and grapefruit the dominent flavors in this one.  What makes this hefe special is the way it finishes.  It finishes so clean with a tinge of wheat and sweetness from the bannana.  Better done than the german hefes that I’ve had.  This is better than their unplugged version which I felt was a little unbalanced.  Will get more.


bannana

holy shit.  this thing has to be the best hefe i have ever drank.  It is also high octane.  Pours out a cloudy yellow color with a large head.  aroma is full of wheat, cloves, and other spices.  flavor is as well adn very refreshing.  This brew certainly took me off guard as i didnt expect it to be so good.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2008 Pours a cloudy, orange cider-like appearance.  The nose bursts of a basket of banana, bubble gum, cinnamon, cloves and an overall fruity aroma.  Has a powerful zing of fruits and spicies, and finishes with a slight warmth of alcohol- especially as it warms.  DMW is a great rendition of the bavarian hefe, as it meets or surpasses the quality of any German hefe available.  An impressive brew from New Glarus.
Bottle.  Hazy, golden orange pour with a thick head that faded quickly.  Aroma of fruity esthers, banana and clove.  Flavor of wheat, fruit and spice.  Outstanding domestic hefeweizen!

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2009 Summary: Wonderful hefe, packed with fruit, wheat, and yeast aroma and flavor.  A good reason to live in Wisconsin.  Aroma: Lots of bubblegum and yeast, some citrus and banana.  Appearance: Hazy amber-gold, enormous fluffy white head.  12 oz. of beer needs a 22 oz. glass. Flavor: Starts off with sweet fruits, cinnamon, banana, citrus. Finishes wheaty with a hint of cloves.  After swallowing, yeast and cinnamon vapors continue to waft through the mouth, while a banana-kumquat flavor resides on the cheeks. Palate: Juicy, generous carbonation buzzes the tongue, while clove-spice elements prickle it.

Bottle courtesy of iowaherkeye.  Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of clove and citrus.  Lots of fruits (citrus, lots of orange, melon) in the mouth, some vegetable notes (same ones I got in the Imperial Weizen).  Strong for a hefe but supremely drinkable.
Bottle. Aroma of solid citrus, clove, banana, other spicing. Flavor also quite spicy, but also sweet and juicy, great interplay. Lively yet creamy mouthfeel. Strong on all fronts.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 Bottle from Piggly Wiggly. Pours a nice, slightly hazed bronze. Nose is light on the banana and cloves, but richly spicy, a touch tart and citric. Taste is very nice and mild, though distinctly deep and flavorful. Sweet and a touch tart, though it doesnt have the big fluffy mouthfeel that would make this over the top. Still, a very good beer.

Bottle from Grimreeser. Pours a hazy golden orange with a huge off white/pale yellow head. Bold banana clove aroma. Medium bodied and bordering on some stickiness in texture. Intial flavor is in character with a hefe- sweet pale wheat malts and banana. Cloves come out mid palate before the finish- which has belgian phenols, yeast, and a hint of alcohol. Like the imperial weizen, I think the alcohol and belgian-esque phenols take this out of hefe territory for me

Huge foaming head sits on top on this cloudy pale gold hefeweizen. Aroma is wheat, citrus and spice. Very creamy mouthfeel, Citrus taste dominates with clove overtones. Very mild aftertaste, not bitter. Stacks up well to its German counterpart, Franzinkaner Hefe-Weissbier. New Glarus got this one right! Enjoy with chicken, salad or alone.

A nice honey gold pour with a two finger white active head.  Unfiltered.  Plenty of carbonation.  A delicious aroma of clove and orange.  When I hear the word "hefeweizen" this is what I think of.  A great example of the style.  Yeast, clove, banana, orange, bubble gum, and spice.  So much good stuff going on in there.  In the mouth it feels smooth and creamy but with lots of effervescence.  Wheat beers often take a beating.  This one kicks ass!

Hazy orange pour with a huge frothy head.  Aroma is very intense, especially for a Hefe...tons (and I mean tons) of banana, lemon, yeast, sweet malts, some clove, and maybe a hint of bubble gum in there behind all that banana...just screams summer at you.  Flavor is also very strong and lively.  There is a bunch of banana, a lot more clove/other spice than I expected from the aroma, yeast, and a heavy dose of citrusy fruits...orange included.  Still getting that slight hint of bubble gum in the flavor as well.  Palate is just near perfect for a Hefe...there’s some body to it, but it doesn’t go too far, and the carbonation was spot on.  Oh yeah, where’s the 7.2%???  I was shocked when I saw this, and still think its a typo.  I’ll give it a bonus point in the overall impression for the fact that I picked up a sixer for $6.99...wonderful beer!

Pours lightly hazy amber with a bit of density to the head.  The aroma has very sweet rich malt, lots of thick pureed bananas, slight clove and some sweetness like cotton candy / bubble gum.  Medium / light body that has a lot of slightly sharp carbonation.  The taste is drier than the aroma with definite wheat, more spice and prevalent banana, but it isn’t overwhelming as the aroma makes you think it will be.  The finish adds a bit of citrus and nectar fruit as well.  A very well constructed hefe.

Bottle from Ryan.  Hot damn, he said this one was good - but I didnt realize how good it really is.  This one pours out a nice light orange color with a big thick head on it.  Smell is very fruity, full of bananas, some yeasty and lemon flavors as well.  No alcohol whatsoever.  Taste is very smooth, easy to drink, and frankly this one just disappeared.  7.2% ? Wow.  Never woulda guessed that one.  This beer is a real deal - $7 bucks a sixer.  Awesome beer - as good as the imperial weizen as well.

Pours a deep yellowish orange pour with a medium sized foamy, off white head that shows good retention. Some spotty lacing is left behind as the head settles down. The aroma shows loads of banana, fresh wheat, clove, cinnamon, and lemon zest. The flavor is full of banana and lemon zest with the wheat present through out. Cinnamon and clove round out the flavors and add depth. The flavor in this is fantastic with everything blending together perfectly. Medium bodied and an almost creamy mouthfeel with just the right amount of carbonation leads the substantial palate. This one finishes clean with a sweet fruit finish that leads you begging for more after each sip. Dan certainly knows his wheat beers. This is fantastic, and the best hefe I’ve ever had.

Pours a cloudy golden bronze with a frothy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, wheat, banana, clove and bread. Flavor is wheat, banana, bubble gum and dough. Finishes somewhat long and dry. Medium bodied sticky texture.

Thanks to iowaherkeye for the bottle - pours a hazy orange, with a foamy, short-lived head - semi-tart aroma, with notes of orange, lemon, clove, wheat (duh), a hefty dose of yeast - nice wheat and tartness up front, followed by a balancing, but mild sweetness, that lets just a bit of the tartness follow through to the finish - in between, we have a healthy amount of clove, bubble gum, over-ripe apples, other spices - not as much banana as you’d expect from an american version of the style, but it is present, as is some phenolic character - nicely balanced - these guys make great wheat beers.

Courtesy TheCheeseMan.  Hazy golden color,  1 cm thick dense off-white head.  Nice bubble-gum and mild clove phenols on the aroma, a tad hint of spice.  Smooth palate, lightly carbonated.  Taste of cloves, mild tobacco, on to a refreshing and slightly dry finish.  Another great NG wheat brew.

Received as an extra in a trade recently.  Hazy, watered-down orange juice color with a huge eggshell head that never quite fades away completely.  Smell is huge banana, clove, and yeast.  I can smell this puppy from a few feet away and I love it.  Taste is similar with tons of banana and clove with a pleasant, yet unexpected amount of citrus hoppiness.  Nice and effervescent with a medium body.  A nice wheat beer coming close to my local favorite Live Oak Hefeweizen.
Draught at the Great Taste of the Midwest 2008.  Potent clovey citric, sweet banana flavors cloves.  Very rich, good finishes nice on the palate.

From the bottle, courtesy of Summer Secret Santa 08, pours a hazy light orange with a thick white foamy head.  Perfect aroma of bananas and cloves, and a bit of yeasty fresh baked bread.  This is a fantastic beer.  This is what a hefe should taste like.  Smooth and just the right carbonation.  Just picture what you think a hefe should taste like after reading all these ratings, and that’s what this is.  Thank you, Santa
Hell yeah.  Refreshing, tickles the tongue, some well balanced flavors and all that other good stuff.  No match to the Unplugged, but stands on its own.

This one explodes with banana flavor. Lots of the other typical Hefe aspects present. Spot on for the style, and NG and Schell have the top two Hefes i have had this year.  I was never a fan until this year, but after having some dandies, im hooked! Good to see this finally made it to Hudson!

served on draft at the glarner stube.  pours a slight yellow with haze.  light orange in the nose that is accentuated in the taste.  slight smoothness from he wheat malt.  phenolics like medicine.  Not sure if this is a bad batch, but it is not good.  There ar emuch better examples out there, but I know Dan makes good beer, wihch makes me think there was a problem with the lines or batch

Pours a cloudy golden bronze with a frothy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, wheat, banana, clove and bread. Flavor is wheat, banana, bubble gum and dough. Finishes somewhat long and dry. Medium bodied sticky texture.

The American wheat is too often a poor excuse for an ale with a little flavor added. This one, however, is the real deal. Banana flavors are strong and there are nice hops. Strong citrus. Well balanced.

Unfiltered orange-yellow with a large slowly dissipating white head that laces spottily as it fades.  Aroma of orange, banana, clove, wheat and toasted malts.  Taste of baznana, clove, spice, cinnamon, sweet malts and a spicy yeasty clove finish.  7.2% ABV?  I had no idea.  This is easily my favorite New Glarus "regular" beer (non fruit/unplugged).

Pours a cloudy orange with a fluffy head. Nose is fruity and spicy, mostly bananas and citrus but I detect some apple in there as well. Smooth, well-balanced flavor. A bit spicy upfront, with clove and nutmeg. Good banana in the flavor as well. Maybe a little of vanilla and powdered sugar in the finish. Mouthfeel is very carbonated, and medium bodied, but satisfying. Wheat beers don’t usually get me dancing, but maybe I’d get on the floor for this one.

Bottle.  Pours very hazy, golden orange with a thick and fluffy white head.  Great looking beer.  Huge aroma with lots of fruit and spices sweet bananas, lemon, some orange, cloves and some other spices, maybe a little ginger.  Great taste, very well balanced, more of the cloves and sweet banana with some bubblegum in the finish.  Very smooth.  Great brew, best hefe I’ve had in quite a while if not ever.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a slightly orange hue. Head is soft and pillowy white. Aroma is strong with clove, banana, and hints of cinnamin and ginger. Clove burst onto the tongue with some spice mixed in. Banana brilliantly comes into play in the middle, leaving you with a spicy banana bread finish. Full bodied and highly carbonated; a little less body would be perfect, but this is so close. I’ve been drinking tons of this since it was released, and will continue drinking it until it’s all gone. I hope they continue making this one; it is a masterpiece. Another amazing beer from an amazing brewer. Do not change the recipe!

This beer was not at all what I was expecting. Wheat beers do not generally thrill me, but this one has a delightfully textured palate of cloves and banana, cinnamon and vanilla against the pleasant wheat base and well carbed mouthfeel. One of the best wheats Ive come across in a while.

What a tastey beer this was. Poured a cloudy, bright yellow colour with a full white foamy head. Very pleasent aroma, moderately sweet, soft spice, coriander, orange peel and bananna. Lemon zest is prevalent.

Cloudy straw color with a thin white head.  Aroma of spice and sweetness really stands out.  Flavor has notes of clove and honey.  Slightly sweet.  Nice flavor, one of the better I have had of the style.

On tap last summer at Great Taste and in 12 oz bottle the of the summer. They ran out at Great Taste in the first 2hrs. Classic orange-yellow haze with huge crown. Aroma has spicy notes of clove and lemon foretelling what awaits. Taste includes strong banana, wheat and yeast flavors mingled together with a powerful citrus effervescence to balance. Remarkably complex. The best beer I sampled at the Great Taste 07. And frankly, the best hefeweizen I have ever tried (even vs. German).  Keep up the great work, New Glarus!

12 oz Bottle. Great pink peppercorn and clove oil nose. Fermented banana. Soft and with minerals. Pours a hazed peach flesh color, with a high foam in off-white, fading slowly. Flavor is soft and rich. Pear through a myriad of savory young herbs. Fresh and sinuous. Evaporative. Explodes in the mouth with carbonation, leaving behind wisps of candied orange peel. The yeast plays cool. It doesnt dominate the profile, but compliments the lightly chewy and full-bodied wheat character. Great balance. Refreshing. This would be out of sight on a warm late spring afternoon. Thanks Brad!

On tap last summer at Great Taste:
Springy and light wheat beer.  Some spice, but too thin too notice.  Refreshing.

12 oz bottle. Its a shame this is only a seasonal brew, because Id be fond of it year-round. Pours like any other Hefe, cloudy and rich. The aroma is inviting, but pales in comparison with the flavor. This is, without a doubt, the best tasting Hefeweizen Ive ever had. Its like drinking down a perfect banana bread, seasoned with cinnamon and cloves. Garnishing this beer with anything would be a waste. Theres not a hint of the high alcohol concentration in the flavor, but you feel it fast.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2008 12 oz. bottle from mreusch.  Pour is slightly hazy orange-yellow with a big, fluffy white head that is quite firm and lasting.  Aroma of fruity bubble gum and banana.  Taste is spot on Hefe, malty, wheaty, nice clean palate, very crisp and refreshing.  Nice soft (and audible) carbonation to clean the palate.  The sweet banana fruit and bubble gum come through in the taste as well.  Really no sign of the 7.2% ABV in this one.  This was a great beer with Stroganoff.  Thanks for giving me this one Matt!  Another great one from New Glarus.

Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Nose of banana yeast ester. Crisp and refreshing on the palate, the spice and banana flavor hang in there for the long ride. Dry wheat flavors and a slight tangy finish feed off the clove spice in the finish.

Pours a cloudy orangey yellow color with a a moderate white head thats frothy at first but dissipates quickly. Smells of grains and booze. Tastes like a hefe. Good, malty, grainy. No sign in the taste of the alcolhol that I smelled on this brew. Palate is just, eh. Needs more carbonation for me. Coats the mouth a bit. Good beer, wont go out of my way to get it though.

12 oz bottle, via mreusch.  Pours a hazy dark gold body under a one finger plus fluffy off-white head that had some pretty good retention.  The nose is full of banana and clove esters with some bubble gum and fluffy yeast.  A light note of honey sweetness and soft subtle wheat.  The flavor is one of the better American Hefes that Ive encountered.  Nice spicy yeast derived clove and banana flavor with a good amount of doughy yeast and slightly sweet wheat.  Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with a nice chewy texture and lively engaging carbonation.  Overall, this is pretty damn good!  This goes right to the top of Hefes that Ive had since rating.

From a 12oz Bottle.  Pours a cloudy, golden yellow color with a thick layer of white head.  Fruity banana, creamy wheat malt, spicy clove, and vanilla creamsickle aromas create a nose thats soft, yet rich in wheat malt and weizen yeast characteristics.  Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel with a sudsy carbonation.  A pleasant wheat malt flavor washes over the plate, along with some spicy cardamom notes.  Finishes clean, with a mild wheat acidic tang and a gentle breath of herbal hops.
Courtesy of Capt. Cougar.  Pours hazy orange with a small white head.  Spaices present in both the aroma and flavor followed with some feint lemons and a little butter.  Finishes a bit dry.

Bottle  shared with Axilla. Poured cloudy orangish gold in color with a small white head. Aroma was mild spices. Taste was spicy, light fruity esters and mildly creamy. The finish was slightly lemony. Overall there wasnt much to this beer but it was pretty good.

Bonus bottle from iowaherkeye on 01/11/07.  Thanks Joey!  Pours with a 1finger head that rapidly diminishes to a highly carbonated medium bubble ring around the edge of the glass.  Cloudy yellow amber color.  Lots of clove and banana from the traditional Hefe yeast.  Nice drinkable hefe aroma.

Thanks to Ughsmash for the bottle. Slightly hazy amber color with a large head. Aroma of lemon, wheat and even some orange citrus. A bit of yeasty banana and cloves. Light to medium body. A fairly good wheat.

bottle from ucusty. pours a hazy orange gold with a fluffy off white head... it smells like banana bread batter!...over ripe bananas, light metallic malt, wheat flour and yeasty spiciness (cinnamon and clove). flavor is very robustly banana with touches yeast, wheat and clove. wheaty finish with longer lingering banana aftertaste.  medium bodied with a creamy palate. medium to high carbonation. kinda one dimensionally banana flavored... but, coming from a guy with a banana tattoo, thats a good thing!

Poured hazy yellow orange. Strong clove aroma with a touch of cinnamon and banana. Very fruity flavor. Lots of banana. Some wheat, but mostly fruit. Finishes pretty sweet. I had no clue this was 7.2%! Very good!

Poured a hazy golden color with a medium sized off-white head.  Wheaty aroma with clove and banana notes.  Some sweetness.  Big banana flavor.  Some sweetness.  Wheaty finish with a medium body.  Light clove spice in the middle.

Bottle from Joe in trade and served in my small Ayinger glass: Slightly cloudy golden hue topped by a big fluffy head and left good lace upon the glassware. The aroma is spot on for the style with lots of banana, clove and floral yeast esters along with some noticeable wheat and herbal vapours. The taste is near the equal of the nose with a fruity overtone supported by wheat and pale biscuity malt. A light handed spice note upon the finish. A "bubblegummy" aftertaste is built with the soft grainy palate. I would however like this to be a bit more sprite. Overall another above average wheat bier from NG. A must try.
12 oz bottle.  Hazy orange after swirling in the yeasties.  Clove and fruity aromas were nice.  Flavor was decent too.  More spice, and wheat twang.  Not bad at all.

Bottle: Cloudy straw with a hint of orange, large pillowy white head, fine lacing. &nbsp Now this is a Wheat Beer! &nbsp Aroma of 

wheat malts, clove, and minor banana. &nbsp Maybe a little musty, or barnish. &nbsp Flavor packs a whole lot of wheat malt flavor, a little 

spritzy, some cloves, but not as much banana as you might have expected. &nbsp Clean, with a little spiced up finish. &nbsp Almost seems 

like  some sort of citrus at the end there. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp Not as heavy as many German examples, but 

the flavor profile is all there. &nbsp Probably one of the better made German Hefeweizens I have had. &nbsp I wished many a brewers could do 

as well as New Glarus in this department. &nbsp Very enjoyable beer. &nbsp Thanks Chris for this winner!

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2007 12oz bottle from CaptainCougar. Pours a deep, cloudy orange with highlights of bright gold, small wisps of drifting yeast, and a very thick (though short-lived), nearly-white head that looks almost like whipped egg whites. The aroma is almost chewy with wheat and malts. It is incredibly wheaty with some notes of banana and vinous, fruity malts. The flavor starts crisp and wheaty. There are some fruity malts (soft fruit, perhaps some banana) and a light touch of spice (allspice and mace). The middle of the tongue detects some spicy, noble hop bitterness and a slight touch of tartness. The finish is refreshing and somewhat dry. The beer ends sweet and fruity with some light balancing hops. The high level of carbonation helps hide the beers full body. The tongue detects textures that are at times silky but at other times almost oily. Overall, a refreshing and intensely flavored hefe-weissbier - if any authentic, German weizen weighed in at over 7%, it would probably taste just like this...

Pours a hazy orange, gold with a very little white head. Aroma is of banana and spice..a hint of cloves. Flavor is a nice cracked wheat with definite banana undertones. The bear has a touch of thickness that fills the mouth, leaving a rich sweet coating and aftertaste. I love New Glarus beer and this wheat is one of the best I have had. 
Well-done hefe!

Finally, an american made German hefe that I can enjoy. Ive had so many piss poor "American" wheats that Ive almost given up hope that Americans can make a good hefe. Well they can and they brew it at New Glarus! 

The beer pours out a hazy yellowish/orangy/gold color, big fluffy white cap. Aroma...sweet bananas, allspice, cloves. Flavors are suprisingly devoid of any banana, but it does have a fantastic light fleshy fruit character, strong wheat/cracker flavor, yeasty with a healthy dose of cloves to finish it. Fantastic beer. Loved every drop of it. Kudos to New Glarus. Every freakin beer they make seems to be fantastic.

12-14-07 bottle.  
Warning: I do not like Hefeweizens.  The aroma was a sweet wit smell with hints or oranges and citrus.  Cloudy orange with wonderful fluffy lasting head.  The taste invokes a gag reflex I cant help - I just dont like the texture or the flavor of Hefeweizens.  There is a coating that this leaves on the tongue that is very hard to get rid of.  However, I can easily see this is a very well made beer, which if I enjoyed Hefeweizens (even slightly) - I would love it.

Big thanks to alexgash from BA for the bottle!Cloudy orange colored pour with a big lasting meringue like head.  Thick wheaty, banana flavor with lots of clovey yeast smell too.  Very big strong hef smell with a light lemony wheatiness as well.    Taste is strong and full bodied with the same flavors.  Very good quality hefeweizen but just a style im style growing to like slowly.
A delightful wheat beer featuring a generous, sweet wheat base layered under a bonanza of spicy, complex yeast residuals.  Great stuff.
Hazy golden colour with a dense white head. Wheaty, banana fruity aroma with yeasty and spicy notes. Sweet fruity flavor with spicy notes.

Very nice typical aroma of heavy clove and banana, along with some lemon notes additionally.  Hazy golden color with an initially thick head which is short lasting.  Flavor does a good job of mimicking the aromas.  A very enjoyable hefe and I can see why this is rated so high.  Up there with some the german greats, such as Westaphaner and the like.  Bar none, New Glarus makes the best weizens in the Western Hemisphere.  This one is excellent.

Thanks to secret santa for this!  Pours cloudy gold with fluffy white head.  Cinnamon, coriander, and apples on the nose. Very complex flavor with hints of banana, bubble-gum, yeast, cloves, and citrus.  Wish i had a few of these while mowing the lawn over the summer; in the humidity of north carolina

Bottle from Duane, Thanks dad!  Poured into a 330mL weizen glass.  Huge head, even for a german hefe.  Cloudy orange/gold color.  Spicy (clove and coriander) aroma with some sweet esters floating around in there as well.  Flavors are pretty complex; banana, citrus, bubble gum, a bit bready, clove and coriander.  A real treat for the palate.  Mouthfeel is borderline thick, which I found odd for a summer beer that is typically light and refreshing.  Still, overall this was a solid offering from NG.

Bottle from Hezron. Hazy pale body with a large, creamy white head. Sweet and fruity nose with banana, cloves, pepper, cotton candy and herbal hops. Lightly sweet, lightly bitter flavor with plenty of herbal and floral hops, a touch of cotton candy and bread as well as banana/clover esters. Medium body is a little bit thin (I guessing typical New Glarus filtering prior to reyeasting for bottle conditioning) with sparkling carbonation. A little alcohol is present in the finish.

Soft and sweet with banana bread and chewy wheat grain. Smooth and creamy. Hazy (really great cloudiness) with a little foaminess. Spicy but sweet flavor. Tiny hints of clove. Well-made beer, one of the better wheat beers out there.

12 oz bottle from iowaherkeye - thanks Joey! Pretty pour - lightly hazed gold with a huge, fluffy eggshell head. Very well carbonated, with streams of bubbles rising up to the head. Wheaty nose, lightly fruity, banana and clove in the fore. Spicy flavors, clove and orange, the wheat takes a back seat. The alcohol shows a bit late in the finish, a warming deep in the gullet. Excellent.

12oz bottle coutesy of my Motherinlaw. Bananna and cinnamon spicey aroma hit the nose. Murky yellow body with big white head. Flavor has a spicey sourness along with the fruity banana well balanced that not one or the other was more dominate. Citrus pear juice aftertaste wish she would of sent me more.
bottle- eh. Very sweet, very boozy, a lot of clove banana taste, with some zip. Not a fan, and surprised that this was rated so highly.
Bottle. Golden body, pretty clear, small white head, clove nose with hints of sweetness. Soft body, sweet, clove, light banana, minimal citric flavor. Does not hide alcohol particularly well.
